column4: A beautiful area to visit that is easily accessible by car with free parking. We started with a walk up the cliffs to see the stunning views on offer which was wonderful. We then pitched up on the small beach and dived into the sea. We swam through the ‘tunnel of love’ and spent some time jumping into the water. We then spent some time snorkelling further out to sea. It was truly a stunning place to swim with the beautiful coves and cliffs. However, I wouldn’t recommend if you are planning on sunbathing as the beach is small and I would imagine it would get very overcrowded during peak season.

Take the cliff path route to Canel D'Amour past restaurants commanding beautiful views over the little beaches and bays below. Great place to sunbath and watch the braver ones jump and dive from small cliffs into the blue waters below but have to admit i didnt attempt it myself.....too my birthdays.There is also a sheltered sandy beach which can become very crowded at times and just above this is outdoor restaurant with panoramic views while enjoying a meal or a cool drink.
Lovely area, nice scenery and plenty of shops, restaurants and bars to choose from. Some parts (i.e. the small beaches) can get a bit crowded but it's nice for a leisurely stroll.

It is a beautiful place to visit with nice restaurants with beautiful views of the sea, some nice shops and bars, if you are fit you can go looking over the hill a lot easier as I have limited mobility I was unable to go there but it looked wonderful, we had some lovely meals at he Sea Garden and the Marie Beach Hotel, also if you go onto the beach you can hire a boat

Definitely a must to visit. We stayed in Sidari and walked . Which was a pleasant walk even in the heat . I would recommend suitable footwear for the rocks and climbing even though lots had flip flops on. Stunning views and great atmosphere. It’s very busy which is expected as soon popular , it’s a must even if it’s just to take in the whole experience and get great photos. Beach was very busy but people coming and going so was easy to get a space . Sea was lovely and great for swimming the mud is great also to put on you write your name in the mud wall. People were jumping from high heights (not for us) good to watch swim through the caves . We didn’t eat or drink there but a few places to eat and drink near. Lovely part of Sidari. People were having a great time.

column3: Crowded and not sure what all the fuss is about
column4: Pleasant enough beach but very small and was crowded. There are much nicer beaches available by car.

Loved the Canal D'Amour its lively but quieter than the main strip. A nice ammount of bars and taverna's and a couple of shops. Visited Fagins every day for breakfast which was lovely, plenty of options and service was fabulous. Sharon was very friendly and attentive, however we did go for our evening meal a couple of times and it was a different story. The food was perfect but the host Donna was very unorganised and often got ours and other orders wrong or mixed up. She just didnt listen to the customer so it all became a bit of a lucky bag. Nothing like the morning service Im sorry to say.

column3: Small crowded beach - lots of litter
column4: Small crowded beach - lots of litter, no sunbeds of umbrellas as shown on some photos & nowhere to clean the sand off your feat.
Very busy through the day, staying in the area so visited late when crowds disappeared. No where near as romantic as described probably because of crowds and rubbish left behind.
Worth to visit. The litle cave gives the best view if You aproach from the see, after You swimm trought the canal. Big parking lot at the entrance, costs 5 euro/day.
very busy but worth it ,swim sunbathe put mud on your face and swim through the tunnel of love.lots of jumping off the rocks too

Nice spot to view out at sea or grab a drink/swim/snack .once you've seen it I don't think you need to go back.there were people sunbathe but why I don't know.id rather be on a sunbed than a hard rock .
Stunning views, warm water. You can swim into the Dionisos cave or jump from a cliff. The beach is easily accessible.
Beautiful, best in the early morning before the crowds. Good selection of restaurants nearby, and other sandy coves. Orange cake at Aquarius Restaurant (Kanali hotel) highly recommend.

What marketing and some touristy ad words can do is best seen here - Canal D'Amour,...wooow A stretch of limestone cliffs which eroded due to sea currents and waves and made a small bay. First of all, don't expect it looks like on the headline pic. In reality the water is murky and the whole area smelly. The beach is very small and overcrowded. As many others said, there's a lot of litter from visitors bringing food and drinks. The cape stretching out to the sea is nice for a pic, yet dangerous to walk on it. Despite a heavy heat I had no desire to swim there. I'd rather consider it a quick photo op if you have nothing else to do. We were staying in a hotel few kms away, but I wouldn't bother coming here from more remote areas on Corfu.

column3: Interesting rock formation, shame about the litter!
column4: This is an unique beach with interesting clay rock formations. From a distance it looks fabulous. On closer inspection, not so! The amount of rubbish in the surrounding area above the beach on the cliffs, and piled at the bottom of the steps of the tiny beach area, was shocking! What is it with visitors? Can't they take their rubbish back to the hotel with them? The water was however lovely and swimming through the cave area was exciting, however strongish swimmers only.
If you stay in Sidari, you must go to Canal D'Amour. You will not regret it. Enjoy a fruit salad and a ice coffee (frapi).

A lovely natural little formation of rock and sea. Situated just outside the main strip of Sidari, approx 800m, this rock formation provides an inlet of about 100m from the main coast line inland. At the foot there is a small beach accessed via a sharp drop in rock formation and steps. Swimming out to sea there is a little cave to swim through which is a unique experience.  Well worth a visit, and will fill an hour or two of your day. Consider combining this with other points of interest in the area to make a great day out.

column3: Lovely place but only for strong swimmers
column4: Great place lots of surrounding bars if you want a drink or food, several different little inlets and good access for all.
Beautiful coast line, that includes several beaches and the unique Cabal no Al D’amour. Very nice views. You could also spend time on the beach or at one of near by bars.
Love this beautiful place. Outstanding natural beuty perfect spot for photos! Definitely stop here if you are visiting Sidari.

column3: Not as good as the pictures
column4: We were really disappointed with this. The water looked really dirty, the access was very uneven and there was loads of litter stacked up that had not been removed. Would not race back here!

column3: Nice at sunset, don’t bother during the day
column4: Nice to visit at sunset, we were staying nearby and would walk along the tops some evenings as the sunset is lovely. Not sure how it can even be classed as a beach as the beach is barely even big enough for 2 or 3 towels is just really a way to get into the water.  Hot and hard work in the day, lots and lots of groups on tours who leave all their rubbish around the too small bins. Often very windy and big waves when we were there which was nice to look at but wouldn’t risk swimming. Really scruffy around it derelict land, abandoned sun beds, rubbish etc seems such a shame.  Nice place to walk to in the evening but I would have been disappointed to tAke a trip to specifically visit.
Very disappointed, the smell gets you first from the dirty stagnant water , worse on a windy day! Litter was everywhere. Tiny beach . Much nicer places to visit in Corfu.

column3: It is a very cheap tiny place
column4: There are so many people trying to scramble into this very tiny space, it is just a joke. There are nasty touristic spaces that surrounds this vile place with many dubious people around.

Great natural rock formation slowly being eaten away by gentle wave action. It wasn't too busy when we visited, so no need to plan your visit. Although the beach is tiny, most visitors tend to sit high up on the rocks at the side. Definitely take the opportunity to swim in the sea, making sure you swim though the tunnel through the rock which is only about 30 metres long. Look back at the rock formation when in the tunnel! It is possible to swim out to sea and round the headland to re-entre the bay. I was warned the tide was strong here, but that wasn't my experience. It is also a great place to watch sunset. It's a free visitor attraction which is rare, so make the most of it. Some layers in the rock are soft clay-like substance. I'm told rubbing it on your face and letting it dry, takes years off you - I'll let others judge if it has!

Absolutely beautiful views and definitely worth a visit! I would recommend sensible footwear as the best views are achieved by a bit of climbing over rocks. There is a beach where you can swim and places to dive from as well

column3: Well worth seeing unlike its’ neighbour Cape Drastis!
column4: My wife and myself are currently holidaying in Corfu and earlier today we went on a day trip to Ericusa and briefly stop to see both Cape Drastis and Canal D’Amour en route back to the Sidari.  Of the two, Canal D’Amour was by far the most impressive - and should, if at all possible, be seen from a boat - with Cape Drastis rather underwhelming! So much so, that I - for one - will be in no great hurry to see it again!
Really worth a visit, natural beauty and thrilling. Can relax on the rock edge and also really good area for rock jumping, if you know how to. Would definitely come back here.

If there is something to see in this area, this is it. The rock formations are beautiful and you can swim around them. If you are brave enough, you can try climbing out under the rocks and explore the little caves and tunnels.
Canal d' Amour visit today, loved going through it but was horrified by the pile of rubbish at the top of the stairs.
Canal D'Amour is the most beautiful place we have been too. There are bars there so you can eat/drink while looking at the stunning views.

A place to visit in Corfu but especially for geological reasons. Beautiful rock formations, the erosion makes the rocks spectacular, the water is amazing. If you go to the Canal d'Amour to spend a day on the beach u could be disappointed because it's a crowded place and the beach is small and not sandy. We were amazed by the view but we left for a better sandy beach and there're a lot nearby.

The canal is beautiful area in Sidari where the sand and limestone rocks have been eroded by sea and wind to form beautiful shapes.It is also famous for watching beautiful sunsets.however the steps that lead down to the beach are broken and dangerous and unless you are quite fit you cannot get down to swim.Considering this is a very busy area with hundreds of visitors a day it surprises me that the north Corfu council not only leave it open but make no effort to make it accessible and safe or clear the rubbish from the beach

Gorgeous and well worth a look and spend the day. With plenty of good restaurants in the area. And loads of pools you can spend the day around, as long as you buy some drinks. We always had our lunches out

column3: Go in the early morning to enjoy the views
column4: Some nice rock formations. The surrounding small beaches get crowded after breakfasts, so if you want to enjoy the unspoiled views, it's best to go there in the early morning.
Recommend a visit here outstanding location breath taking views a few bars and restaurants nearby as well to try

We had heard and read great reviews about the Canal d‘Amour, promising a romantic spot with amazing views and the opportunity for a swim in a unique and beautiful location. What you get instead is a small formation of mud and rocks right behind a bunch of cheap hotels and bars right in the middle of a busy, touristy village. It‘s absolutely crowded with people trying to take a photo or go swim at the incredibly tiny beach area that fits approx. 4 people. There is nothing remotely romantic about this place, don‘t be fooled. Unless you consider piles of rubbish on the grounds, crowds of people and loud music romantic. Don’t waste your time coming here when there are way more beautiful coves and beaches all over the island!
great little place to visit and bathe, nice surroundings, cliff walks, plenty of bars ,cafes etc very laid back

column3: Overrated doesn't even begin to describe it.
column4: People rave about this place as if it's a sight to behold. Sorry, but it just isn't. It's some jagged rocks, surrounded by tacky hotels and takes a grand total of two minutes to look around.

The place is beautiful as advertised definitely worth the trip and the dip. Hiring a kayak just next to the place and exploring the cave and tunnel is spectacular. Strong currents during tides be extra careful if you swim it. The Hotels around it make it a bit overcrowded at peak seasons besides that warmly recommended

column3: Lovely place to relax and enjoy
column4: After reading the previous reviews I felt I had to write my own as it was so unjust. The Canal D Amour is an area of natural beauty. There are various bays to look at with interesting rock formations in the sea. If you don’t take the time to explore then yes, you may only see the small strip of beach on which to sunbathe. Look to the local beach bar what a lovely place to eat reasonably priced food of very high quality then check out the area on the cliffs to sunbathe on and the other beaches and shallow caves, all with stunning views. Yes, there aren’t concrete pavements everywhere just normal pavement.  I honestly feel some people should stay in their built up cities and leave beautiful areas like the Canal D Amour for those of us who appreciate natural beauty. Oh and the nearby Sidari strip is only a 10 minute walk away for a lively night if that’s what you want to do all good in small measure.
a little bit crowded, but a place with great water and the canal that everyone can swim through. It's interesting to experience.
access not maintained and a bit scruffy but the views from local restaurants and bars very nice a smelly river nearby avoided

I’m surprised at some of the negative views on this place, the sea was crystal clear and people were jumping off the cliffs into the sea. Stunning scenery and I so wish we had our swimming gear with us. We got some stunning photos and had one of the best days of our holiday. Would definitely return.

I’m sure this was pretty once, but it is now a rubbish strewn dump (rubbish in the water and overflowing bins on the paths approaching the beach). Surrounded by nasty, half built hotels and bars. If this is one of the best things to do in Corfu, I’d hate to see the worst.
Really loved the Canal d'Amour beach and surroundings. It did get busy at times during the day but was nice and quiet in the evening. Beautiful spot for a nice family photo.

We went there by car, horrible to get there and not clearly instructed by road signs where to go. Parking spot was on the top of a hill with (luckily) just 1 spot left for our car. When we arrived at Canal d’ amour it was crowded like crazy, a lot of kids blasting all sorts of music through speakers. On the small beach part there were barely any spots to leave your stuff (definitely no lying down there) the canal itself was crowded with swimmers too, the waters were good and there was a nice little cave nearby which u could swim through. In my opinion it isn’t worth it to go there again. Just took the swim and got away as fast as possible.

column3: Amazing views and such a fun day
column4: PLEASE visit Canal D'Amour whilst in Sidari!  One day during our holiday we just went for a stroll and came across this amazing beach. We were so happy to have found it and visited 2 times after that.  The views are breathtaking.  We hired a pedalo for an hour for €10 which we thought was so good for the location and it really did make the trip that whole lot better.  If you're looking for a spot for lunch whilst here definitely go to Canal D'Amour Beach Bar and Restaurant!

Nice place, very romantic. We stopped there for about 45 minutes, just the time to get refreshed and swim. There was a beautiful passage under the cliff where swimmers can pass through and take some picts if they have a waterproof camera. Shame the water was a bit cloudy, but I guess it was because of the terrain which was kind of clayish and slippery.
Idyllic beach and surprisingly not crowded, despite being a famous tourist spot. There are a few caves to explore a short swim away.

column3: Good for a nice walk around
column4: If you want to make a trip, plan to visit for 20 mins max and have other plans for the day too. Keep your expectations low and you will have great experience. Make a short walk, take some pics and move on.  Corfu has other great places worth to see!
Location is beautiful. was very busy and with all the hotels above it, made it feel overcrowded and congested. Would recommend hiring a boat to view it from the seas
What a disappointment !!! The canal is full of trash and plastic bottles. The surrounding is terrible. It may have been nice before all the hotels and bar have corrupted the place…
This a beauty spot , you can sunbath here but it is very popular so crowed , there are lot of hotels , bars and restaurants in the area. But take a look.

After reading the previous review I felt I had to write my own as it was so ludicrous. The Canal D Amour is an area of natural beauty. There are various bays to look at with interesting rock formations in the sea. If you don’t take the time to explore then yes, you may only see the closest bay with its small strip of beach on which to sunbathe. Explore beyond that though and there are cliffs to sunbathe on and other beaches and shallow caves to explore in the sea, all with stunning views. Yes, there aren’t concrete pavements everywhere but this is an area of natural beauty!!! If you want a nice pavement, maybe try the prom at Benidorm. The comments about “typical hooligan British” is just ridiculous considering most British planes to the Island were grounded. I honestly feel some people should stay in their built up cities and leave beautiful areas like the Canal D Amour for those of us who appreciate natural beauty. Oh and prices are reasonable, similar to nearby Sidari.

Worst place in corfu.  Super crowded with those typical britains that resemble hooligans and botox ladies.  I felt bad for the unlucky families that chosen that place to stay.  Beaches are dirty and lack infrastructures for proper sun bathing.  The place can be windy so prepare yourself to eat dirt. Yes , dirt! There is not even a proper side Walk there.  If you want to eat, enjoy yourself at the tastfulless restaurants with little or none quality in service and cuisine.  With that said, if you enjoy barbarian environments with terrible food, you just found paradise.  This is not greece , it stands way behind the other places corfu has to offer.  Oh, and ir ia not cheap so I would rasteje

driving around corfu we had a day at this place. View is nice up the cliffs and all sidari beach has lots af restaurants for breakfast or lunch. Some cleaning of the beach from plastic bottles, cups, etc must be done.

This area is stunning. I was very fortunate to arrive at a time when it wasn't terribly overrun by tourists (good for me, not good for businesses) but even with fewer tourists, so many people litter the beach and surrounding area. If you love it here so much, is it really that hard to carry out the garbage that you brought in?  The local people are lovely and you will never run out of landscape to explore along the trails. Just respect the place on your vacation, please.

column3: Avoid this place if you want to relax!!!
column4: A lot of bars, nightclubs... nothing authentic in this place. Drove the way from Kassiopi and regret it. There are better beaches in Corfu (Mpataria beach and Kalami looked better and were less crowded). Good place if you want to party though.
Really nice beach with amazing rocks and nice view. It was really quiet at the minute but was still amazing
One of the best places with amazing view. We can not wait come back in summer 2021. The beach and the area is fantastic for children and adults.
We came up here to see what it was like and it was amazing the views were great and it was so scenic with a couple of cliffside bars
Just a pretty place with many good memories. Highly recommended and stunning. You can stay there all day and just forget about your problems.
This was one of my favourite places to go in sadari, lovely restaurant, great views, beautiful people,

This was a fabulous place the rocks are beautiful sea so clear and fabulous to swim in we walked from our apartments it was about a twenty minute walk we went to the restaurant and gardens overlooking the sea it is absolutely stunning the seating area was lovely with swing chairs and sunbeds like a double bed. We went about five times

A stunning place to visit when in Sidari. Beautiful and romantic. Lots of nice hidden coves to sunbathe and swim, definitely worth a visit, we visited twice. Stunning scenery, crystal blue waters, some lovely restaurants nearby to sit and admire the views.

column3: Don't miss the beautiful water, swimming and view. Gorgeous any time of day!
column4: Visited during the last week of October. It's hard to find your first time there. You can't access it from the main road in Sidari. You have to drive down a private looking road toward the Aquarius restaurant. You can park for free at the restaurant if you order something (which has a great view of the cliffs and water if you eat outside). Or you can just drive up past the restaurant to park in an unmarked field. It's free November-March in the off season.  The water is gorgeous and you can swim in the cave that goes under the cliff. We had a lot of fun in the water here. There is a very small rocky and sandy beach and some people lay on the cliff to sunbathe. There are many restaurants nearby but I think they all close Nov-March.
Beautiful part of Sidari water is so clear. We did a lovely walk along the coast to the beach room about 30 mins well worth it

we only spent an hour or so here as we were on our way back to our own resort and we wished we were staying here instead, lovely views and great bars and restaurants everywhere would make for a great stay
Well worth a visit, the rock formation is really unusual. We went in October so it was really quiet, would imagine it could get really busy aft peak times.
Great snorkelling in clear waters. The one thing to remember is to stay clear of the boost areas - the people steering these were not mindful of swimmers.

column3: Nice spot on a sunny day
column4: Nice spot on a sunny day sadly for us not so, but nice rock formations, a must if you are in Sidari.
Layers of caramel rock forms the vision towards the sea giving you a most pleasant walk along the coast of Sidari Glad that you'd made the effort in the midday sun in October 20.
Omg this was beautiful.. some much better in real life.. Went for a swim and the water is so clear and calm
Drove here today from kavos took 2hours was worth the trip! Place is beautiful and great for jumping of cliffs
Beautiful place to visit. Lots of places to explore either walking or swimming along with nice bars and restautants to appreciate the view
Lovely area, somewhat over developed but as we visited late in the season in 2020 it was much quieter than I would expect it to be in the height of summer.
Such a beautiful spot, me and my wife swam in the sea and it was so clear then enjoyed a chilled out sun bathe

column3: A nice place to have a walk around
column4: We visited Canal D’Armour for a walk around during the afternoon. Lovely views and a different walk but you do have to travel through a proper ‘Brits Abroad’ resort strip which isn’t so nice...

column3: beautiful !! great for a day out
column4: absolutely beautiful . Must see when in sidari !! water is soo clear and is a nice small beach for you to enjoy

Canal D'Amour could be such a beautiful area and probably once was but the whole area, including Sidari is very grubby. Returned home this week from a pleasant holiday but couldnt help but notice the litter around the whole of Sidari. Where are the road sweepers. What are the council doing about it? Tourism there will die if nothing is done about this shabby town. It could be beautiful but just isnt. Such a shame...!!!

We travelled here at midday ish and unfortunately the small beach was already full and there was people everywhere it's a beautiful ace but was jsut a bit busy for us personally we prefer quieter beaches.
Beautiful place! We went there September 20 and there was not so many tourists there, so it was great.
Unfortunately cafes, restaurants and sunbeds have destroyed the beauty of nature. If only we could see the place 70 years ago.
Best thing ever! Christal clear water, secluded landscape and easy to access it. I recommend it. Nice for photos and a good swim 🏊‍♂️

column3: Fantastic location, great beach bars and restaurants!
column4: What a beauty! The place is insane, we absolutely loved it! So many restaurants to choose from, so many bars, a great vibes. One can also do some water sports and many other activities around the beach. The Canal d'amour itself is stunning, a dream for all the Instagramers out there! Highly recommend it :-)
Beautiful views, not suitable if you have mobility issues. FREE entry. better view from boat trip. do not forget your cam.
Had a fab day out here, it was quite quiet, obviously due to the current circumstances, but still lovely, glad we went

Love this place of natural beauty been myself twice before and took my grand daughter this year she loved it even managed to get her up for sunrise which is a must do while staying in this area STUNNING
A must se place when you visit Corfu. I strongly recomend Canal D'Amour. Beautifull view of Corfu island from the hills

column3: Good walk away from the action
column4: The walk that all 10 of us went away on away from the hustle and bustle of the main strip, we went over the hill and coming back past the smartline mimosa. We also took a small break in one of the cove beaches and the stairs were rather rickerty and it is an accident waiting to happen

The cliffs were interesting and the sea was pretty. We were disappointed in the amount of litter around the area. There was enough litter to distract us from the sights. Pretty touristy place. It was worth it to see once, but we wouldn't go back.
The best place we visited in Corfu. We would return here again and again. It was merely perfection! We rented paddle boards and a paddle boat and it was magical. Highly recommend!
Would definitely advise a visit to Canal D’Amour it is beautiful and is a great place to cool off. The beach can get a bit busy so it is advisable to arrive earlier in the day.

column3: A real find - well worth a visit
column4: We weren't quite sure what to expect - read about a good spot to visit on Tripadvisor. What we were met with was brilliant... a tiny high-sided cove, with a mini beach, but with cliff walls that you can jump off into to the water (varying heights to test your bravery). Great fun. Then we discovered the secret water tunnel which you can swim through. Lovers scratch their names into the sandstone walls. It is said you meet your soul mate if you swim here. Go for it.
Nice beach and sea gallery, but maybe nothing so special compared to others corfu interesting points.

column3: Simply stunning - well worth a day trip
column4: Stunning place - Sidari was a bit too British for us to stay here for more than a day but none the less a great day out and the Canal D’Armor was a great sight and some real nice beach bars there as well.

The beach itself is beautiful. Unfortunately, we parked our bike close to a restaurant and when we came back the owner was shouting and being aggressive with customers from the nearby hotels and restaurants like a maniac. AVOID that restaurant at any cost, its called The Famous Canal D amour snack and pool bar. I guess it should be called the "infamous" canal d amour restaurant. We searched for details online about that place and there is absolutely nothing. In our hotel they told us the owner of THE FAMOUS CANAL D AMOUR is known all over the island for being a savage. We also noticed nobody was wearing a mask in the restaurant, including the owner.

column3: Stunning place to watch folk jump and dive into the water
column4: A stunning place especially at sunset, lots of people watching to be done here and with the added bonus of watching the younger people and occasionally not so young jumping and diving from the cliffs into the water below. It has the added bonus of using the natural clay to give you a free face and body scrub which most use. Beautiful spot and a must do attraction

Visited just after heavy rainfall so the canal was really quiet. The views are so lovely and the little cove round the back ideal for a visit with kids. You do have to be careful and it’s best to wear proper footwear and not flip flops. Some great photo opportunities and worth a visit.

We have just returned from 4 nights in Sidari and visited this beach every day. The prettiest beach I’ve ever been too, lovely and spacious with comfy sun loungers belonging to bars along the beach for a small spend. Recommend going for a walk through the coves and paths to take you further along, we didn’t discover the hidden beaches until our last evening sadly!
Visited everyday throughout our two week stay, gets very busy with tourists but lovely when quiet in the mornings and evenings.
This is indeed paradise !! Daybeds cost 5 euros. But the staff are wonderful and the atmosphere is fabulous!!! Cant wait to come back soon !

This is a tourist trap. Arrived mid afternoon and was thoroughly disappointed. sidari itself felt like a place where English tourists would go on a stag do (read, not nice), and to get.to the beach one option was to walk through a hotel. It was extremely crowded (no socia distancing during covod-19)  The beach was busy, overcrowded, the water just didn't even look as clear as other beaches . Took one look and went back to the car
This area is a must if you visit Sidari.The water was beautiful and plenty of people swimming.Lots of lovely reasonably priced bars in the area

column3: Lovely sunset, good for jumping in to the sea from the rocks.
column4: Beautiful views at sunset and a great place to swim and jump in during the day too! Would recommend and much nicer than sidari beach.

Leeds Liverpool canal !!!! Canal boats ! Venice canals !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Gondolas ! I’m a big fan of canals and the varying floatation devices that go along canals . So me and my wife have seen this . “ canal of love “ and spent our life savings to come and see this ! We both expected big rideable swans or a heart shaped pedelo. But no . It’s just a bit of the sea with rocks either side . Maybe changing its name to bit of sea with rocks either side damour would be better .  Nice view though
We spent a day and an evening here, and it made the holiday. Recommend getting a sun lounger through the D’amour Beach Bar and going to their Greek night.

Arrive early morning for the best views. After 10 it’s so busy you can’t even stand up there without getting in the way of someone’s Instagram picture. I arrived at sunrise one morning and had a lovely time chilling by the sea.

Due to covid we didn't want to spend too much time (none at all!) in the hotel pools and found that the beaches at Canal d'Amour were all lovely. Sea was warm and crystal clear and the beaches were mostly empty

We were spoiled this year given the fact that they weren’t that many people due to corona. Canal d’Amour was able to shine in its beauty.  Given the popularity of the sport, there’s plenty of restaurants and accommodations very close to the beach which make it a bit overcrowded. Make sure to walk along the shoreline and watch the water and it’s amazing colors.
Beautiful views and coves for sunbathing and swimming. Lovely walk to this place from our hotel and lots of shops and places to eat along the way
Fun to go here. The Italian youngsters love to jump in The sea via the cliffs.. Such wonderful views and nice bars along the way
Beatiful place, with warm sea. Entry free. There are beatiful views and small beach with sand. There are caves, but is there forbidden.
Lovely to walk on the cliffs round the cove also a lovely little beach where the sea is beautiful walk a bit further on you can eat and have a drink

I found the bed expensive but the views are breath taking especially if you love sun sets, unfortunately it gets a bit hard to swim when it’s windy as the sea gets choppy here but it really is a must see..  Don’t visit Corfu without watching a sunset here Just beautiful

Great place , you have to walk through hotel grounds to get there , good place for pit stop on the way. Can get very busy in summer months but some great views and great places to jump in if that’s your thing.id planned to jump but found it too busy and bottled it . My tip go early or late afternoon .we had a quad bike and went all over the north of the island, would go back .

column3: Natural rock formation worth a visit
column4: It is a place worth a visit, due to spectacular views towards the sea. Unfortunately, most of the surrounding area is occupied by large hotels with eating and drinking people. Difficult to park nearby, lots of tourists on the rocks all the time. Nevertheless, worth a visit when in Corfu.

This is the most beautiful and tranquil spot I’ve visited on Corfu. As you walk over the bridge and up the dusty road, at the end is an entrance. Continue over the luscious grassy area and wow the scenery is breathtaking. A quaint cove with gentle lapping waves it can be quite busy but it really worth a visit to experience this for yourself.

column3: Not what it was (but what is?)
column4: Last visited Canal D'Amour over 30 years ago when there were no buildings up close, but naturally over time everything changes. We were going to have a swim, but it was way too windy and rough. The canal itself has also changed, but to be expected as the surrounds/edges are quite soft and erosion does the rest. Still worth a visit.
The canal and its surroundings are a great place for beautiful pictures. Located right next to Sidari beach.

Stayed in Sidari for a week holiday. We enjoyed our stay because we lived close to canal d'Amour and could take some nice evening walks as there is a path a long the Beach cliffs. Unfortunately there are lots of trash around and during the day many loud tourists screaming and jumping from the cliffs..
Had a lovely walk around here it has very pretty views.there are a lot of nice chilling seating areas didn't eat or drink hers but worth a visit for the viww

Enjoyed our visit here. After a day in the next cove on the beach we spent a good time here. Spend some time to sit and watch the water lapping, it is very peaceful in a lovely setting. People do swim between the rocks too. The formation of the rocks is quite fascinating. Worth a visit.
Place is easy to reach. It's full of fair rocks and blue water. It's nice to chill there and swimm if you are not affraid of deep water.

column3: Great Rock formations and crystal clear water
column4: Great Rock formations and crystal clear water. The actual beach is quite small and in the shade today but there are other nice coves and beaches to also go to. A number of restaurants line the cliff tops. A very pleasant and relaxing area.

A really nice place to walk around during the day or simply relax at the beach. Fantastic views and natural stone landscape make for a good wander round or dip in the sea. There are various restaurants and bars to visit in the area for a bite to eat, a beer or a cocktail (all reasonably priced too). We found Canal D'amour Beach Bar great for free sunbeds, nice food and good service.
What a natural beauty post. Easily reached on foot. Well worth a visit.The sea is a lovely shade of blue. A photographers delight.

Beautiful Place to visit, must see for amazing views and to get that special picture. Small beach so need to get there early, but plenty of space on the cliff to put your towel. Lovely little cove to swim, and some days like a mill pond, loved it as it wasn't too deep and water clear.
Nice place beaches are small but realy nice to sit and relax ,plenty of bars to get a drink and food very friendly
Excellent Everybody is friendly and there's loads to do do would recommend getting a quad and touring the island .
very nice area the only thing was there were lots of rubbish around seams to lack bin wagons on a regular basis

column3: Too many folk, not enough room
column4: Wanted to see this as it’s in all the sidari postcards. Glad I did, so I don’t need to see it again. Over populated, very little beach space. Never again.
Beautiful place, worth a visit , very picturesque. not suitable for wheelchairs and reduced mobility .

A must visit in Sidari...great for a lovely swim. Please wear sensible shoes it would be easy to slip on the rocks...lovely to watch the sun setting over the rocks and great to see them from the sea xx
While staying in Sidari most nights we walked about even during the day time and the area was nice, clean and plenty of pubs and bars.  Really nice.

Small but so beautiful place in Corfu. Upon arrival, you have car park available and various restaurants. My recommendation is to walk straight until you reach the canal d'amour and go down the steps for a nice swimming and relaxing. We haven't had any meal in the local restaurants.
Sandy rocks and very smsll beach. I was there in october and it was full with people. I can imagine how there is during hot season.

Canal D'Amour is worth visiting however Sidari is full of brits and chavs on tour. I came to corfu for the culture great Mediterranean food and landscape. Sidari is like Blackpool Barry island and benidorm combined. A forest of satellite dishes showing sport English breakfast everywhere tattoo artists bingo and book early to avoid disappointment and not getting Sunday lunch. It was such a relief to drive away. The saddest and most chav resort on corfu. Please build a trump type wall to keep the chavs in

We walked on the cliff paths and took some nice photos of the views and the clear blue sea. But step a few feet off the paved path and the area is a litter-strewn toilet (complete with discarded bog roll). Views elsewhere on Corfu are just as nice, and considerably cleaner. I agree with other reviewers: come on bar, restaurant and hotel operators of Sidari - sort out this mess.

This is a great viewing area to take photos during the day, and at sunset, but I can only imagine how busy it gets in the summer, it was busy when we went end Sept. worth a visit if your in the area there is also a restaurant and a bar if you need refreshments. Also great if you fancy a dip in the sea or sunbathe.
A great area for taking photos,and watching the swimmers..and plenty of tavernas near by with a sea view to have a nice cool drink
Not much to say accept it's a beautiful place with amazing views and scenery with nice bars/restaurants near by.
It was very beautiful to see in person. The picture depicts the water from high above. It doesn’t look quite that blue up close. But it’s still worth a visit!

Absolutely stunning.after seeing it once I just kept going back.the water is turquoise blue and there are little sandy coves for sunbathing.if you want peace and quiet and stunning views try this place.

Visited on a day trip to Sidari from Roda. Yes, potentially stunning but alas spoilt by its popularity. A small picturesque cove teeming with bodies! We visited in September, would only wonder what it would be like in high season. Better to use the main beach I would think 🤔
We got the bus to Sidari to see this. Sidari is a dump, but don’t let that put you off. The Canal d'amour is well worth seeing.

Beautiful place, we were based on the main strip last year but opted for canal damour this year and hardly left this area, its beautiful, lovely restaurants nice shops and the beaches are beautifil. Great value for money and such a mixture of people, young and older, romantic as well especially for younger couples, cant wait to go back in june

I don't recommend this place. At first - too many people. There's tiny beach near this place so people lies on the rocks as seals... Then the rocks around this place consist of the clay and water is muddy. Maybe, sunset at this place is beautiful, but if you don't live near Sidari - don't waste your time, there are a lot of other nice places on Corfu

This is a beautiful location but there are just too many people. I've never seen such a densely packed beach. Because of all the clay, the water is cloudy so snorkelling was hopeless. We much preferred the nearby Apotripiti Beach.
It’s a lovely place to have a walk round taking in the sun, far away from the strip area where things were a little different. Plenty of sun bathing and swimming around the area
Superb restaurant right next to Sidari Beach.We had breakfast there nearly every day before going to the beach. Sun loungers are free if you have a drink or a meal there.

Different and glad we've seen it but to be honest it's a bit overrated in my opion. The area is dirty but that's the fault of visitors not the scenery. It's a shame that some humans feel it's ok to leave the rubbish and cigarette butts as a parting gift to future visitors
Beautiful beach with stunning views. Very busy so probably worth visiting early.  Downside was the amount of discarded rubbish and bottles and the way to Canal D'amour.
Great place to come and visit and enjoy the panoramic views . The weather helped enormously and the company of course

I think canal d’amour makes Sidari. I found some parts of Sidari quite scruffy and lacking attention yet the view from this area of the beach was really pretty.  The water so clear and blue - lovely for a swim :-)

Short walk round Sidari's beach to the headland which is almost split into two by the sea. The first inlet creates a wave-machine effect when the tide is right. The second crashes over the rocks onto the beach catching walkers unaware. A walk up through the bushes takes you to the top where the views are breath taking. Sandstone layers create wonderful photo opportunities.
If you are in Sidari center you can look it up, but any other time it will be a waste of time. Small beach, common views, lot of tourists and some kind of weird smell :/
Fantastic to see how the sea has eroded the rock in this area to create a deep channel with the water gushing in and out.
Beautyful views and great place for swimming, take a picnic at night and sit on the rocks, not realy good if your dodgy on your legs , can be a bit slippy due to the rock formation and slopes
Definitely recommend this place it’s so beautiful and with its beautiful beaches and restaurants.👌🏻👌🏻🇬🇷🇬🇷🇬🇷🇬🇷

A good place to come to look at the sea views the canal d’amour it’s self is a bit underwhelming but it’s good to watch all the people jumping from the high rocks. And to have a refreshing swim .There is a small beach nearby and some bars and restaurants.worth a look
You can swim in the lovely blue warm sea, and if brave enough you can swim through the tunnel. If not you can sis on the beach and admire the view of others swimming.

This place is only beautiful,and a must if you visit Sidari.The white cliffs,the numerous small bays with its little beaches,the color of the sea... It is worth to walk all the way around,along the coast,and also to take a boat from Cap Drastes which brings you also to the canal.
Beautiful evening views, well worth a trip, get a nice dessert from the bars and watch the sea and views. Nice desserts
What a place,absolutely fabulous.scenery is amazing.swimming is lovely and relaxing.shops and restaurants there fab.
Beautiful place. Great place to swimming, ramble between the canals, scuba diving and rock climbing. I spend great time here

Beautiful place...this is a must if your in sidari..many places to eat and drink also..sea is beautiful for a dip or swim too cool down and water not cold just right😊we will definately be returning next year i cant wait..love this place and ppl lovely

The view is espectacular, but.... you have to cross a hotel’s pool bar to reach the place. On the beach there are a loads of dirty sunbed, the water is also dirty. We couldn’t enjoy the landscape because of the tourists. Just take a picture and go to another beach.
Very Romantic place only after 7 pm. Earlier there is a lot of people and restaurants just behind rocks. Not deep water with beatiful color.

If you've read a lot of stories about using this place to improve the quality of a relationship - be careful, swimming here is next to impossible. The water is rough and slopes are steep. It's hard to get in and even harder to get out. There is an alternative canal a little bit to the left, with a small island you can swim to.

column3: Went for a morning walk here daily..small beach,very busy late morning. Went for a morning walk here daily..small beach,
column4: Went for a morning walk here daily..small beach,very busy late morning. Preferred the main beach in sidari
beautiful place, but unfortunately overcrowded..... too many people, too much rubbish and noise around that it is difficult to feel the beauty of this unique place

column3: Interesting to see but wouldn’t stay for longer than 10 mins
column4: The rock formations themselves were interesting to see for ten minutes, but the beach itself was tiny and littered. The water looked pretty dirty too.

Stay for 2 weeks with family and friends the area is so nice we was all jumping into the sea from the rocks which was all good fun some nice restaurants with great sea view everything close at hand bars/shops will definitely return
A must visit lovely warm water and very shallow great for kids and adults to swim to the caves. Plenty of bars on the way and don’t forget to take your cameras .

It's such a shame to see such a wonderful part of the world covered in plastic bottles, rab ends and just piles of litter. Think about what you leave around when you leave or places like this will drown under the sh1te you leave behind.
Absolutely worth a visit as is the surrounding area. Lots of bathing freely available but honestly disappointed in the quality of the sand. But it is sandy, only dark.
Picturesque, relaxing, clean and lovely to explore. Not advised for anyone with walking difficulties.
Although the place itself looks nice, you can barely find free sunbeds or areas to put your towel down. All that in September. I'd suggest avoiding it in season.

Have visited the beach on the 20th of August. We wanted to swim but due to cold wind from the Alps the water was ice cold. The naming of Channel of Love comes from the tradition that all couples swimming there remain in love forever. Access to the Channel of Love is easy, by car you can get very close to the beach. Many tourists were already there when we arrived, therefore it is wise to get there early in the morning in order to find some space and you must also be very patient because it is very crowded. Definitely suggested.
Decided to visit early evening . Glad we did as virtually deserted . Lovely picturesque inlet . Worth a look .

this is a beautiful area to come and explore, views are spectacular especially if you come to watch the sunset. Lots of beach bars surrounding it which let you use their sunbeds for free, or you can use the ones on the beach and there are a few private alcoves to. sea is blue and lots of people able to dive from some good heights. def worth a walk up both sides of it
A beautiful place. You must visit . It's a traditional Greek swimming hole with many historic myths of fertility and live when you swim here.
Just like the name this place is a real love. Its such a beautiful sea and nature. Easy to find peace and relax.
I nice little beach, great tarrace, beautifull view, lovely to swimm through the canal a nice place for a day at the beach

After twisting and turning through the mountainside, one arrives.  If you are driving by car, follow google maps directions to the end point. We were lucky to find a few open parking spots.  The beach is much smaller than the photos portray but intimate indeed. Beautiful spot to take photos.

It is an interesting piece of nature to see, but there are so many people, buildings and restaurants that it is an absolute chaos. I'm ok that we saw it but I don't really recommend the place. If you go be sure to swim through the little cave. It was interesting.
Cool place for few hours by the seaside. The place is quite famous so it's almost always crowded. Nice view all around and clean water!

One of the most overrated tourist attractions in Corfu. A V shaped canal ending in a narrow crowded beach. Didn't get to test the superstition though. They say that couples that kiss in the love canal will get married in a years turn :)
Had a rather over-priced and very disappointing Greek salad overlooking the bay - beautiful view though although it felt a little too commercialised for me.

It is a very nice beach with very good spots to jump from a high place. The disadvantage is that the places for putting your beach towel are not that good because you do not have sand. The main beach it is only for clients of a restaurant nearby.

column3: Boom boxes, crowded, cloudy water, litter everywhere
column4: If you have a car, skip this beach and ignore positive reviews. You walk past 6 stinking garbage dumpsters to get to the beach and pass kids with boom boxes going to and from the beach on your way. That should be warning enough. Beach is small and crowded and water cloudy. Can’t see the appeal on an island that has so much more to offer.
Pathways need renewing as dangerous especially for young children - no safety.  Views are beautiful. Some lovely restaurants overlooking sea and views.

column3: Swimming amongst the litter - canal de poubelle
column4: Similar to my review of the Sidari area, the Canal d'amour area needs a major clean up. The photos I have seen do not represent the reality, that this area is very polluted and leaking litter into the ocean. We went expecting to swim, but I didn't want to because of all the litter and the stinking stagnant river nearby. I understand that tourists are likely the cause of the problem, but tourists can be encouraged to leave areas clean if there are rubbish bins available but also obviously emptied, and if the litter is removed (as per broken windows theory). The council really needs to clean it up, or the local proprietors should take it upon themselves to improve the canal area and the main beach. The beaches are their business partners. If things do not improve I think the tourists will stop coming and the businesses will lose their livelihoods.
This is the best beach in sidari, clear waters, clay rocks and very warm! It is a little bit of a walk from main sidari but it is totally worth it!

Drove over from the other end of Sidari. Parking we found was 10 Euros! Husband drove back out and we parked some way away for free and walked in. The approach to the beach is cheap and tacky imo. I kept saying the beach would be lovely but when we got there and saw the packed out beach with no space (far too many loungers), we turned around and left. It looked awful, ugly and tacky and you couldn't pay me to stay there. We headed to the other end of Sidari and a lovely time on a beautiful, quiet, spacious beach! My advice... avoid Canal d'Amour end of Sidari.
Arrived and it was already heaving, overcrowded with loud people .  Recommend attending early for a swim or not at all . Many nicer spots

column3: Beautiful place to visit and take pictures .
column4: When we googled Sidari and found this gem we just knew we had to visit it.  The scenery is beautiful, the water is incredibly blue. They also did a good job in setting up a pathway so that you are able to walk around and enjoy the scenery.  There are also pathways on top of the rocks so you can take kick-ass photos.  Not recommended to wear slippers (it's slippery) go for sandals.  What really bummed me up is the fact that the forestry on top of the rocks it was full of plastic bottles... that kind of triggered me a bit.

column3: great place to swim but be careful its hard getting back out
column4: great beach but buy a float as its hard getting out once you have swam round the rock... theres a rope but please only go with a strong swimmer , beautiful setting and loved watching the brace 1s just in off the rocks.. again please be careful

Spent the whole day out in the lovely beach of Canal D’amour. In the morning able to swim around the beach and take out a pedalo for 10 euros per hour. The restaurants have a lovely swimming pool, bar, tables, sun beds and kind people. Able to have lovely seafood lunch and walk around the little shops of Sidari. Have a lovely entertaining evening with dancing and singing at the restaurant with three main course for 20 euros per person depending on the event. Definitely recommend for family, friends and couples.

We were staying at the hotel right on the Canal D’Amour, so it was like a minute walk from us. We visited a few times during our holiday and it is very pretty. Great place to take photos, but it can get busy. The actual beach part is not great, and is very small and full of sun beds that you have to pay for. I went into the sea and swam into the cave type things and it was really lovely. Quite warm once you’re in there.

Lovely clean warm sea, stays shallow quite far out so can swim to rocks out at sea, different little coves. Took the sunset cruise fantastic views of the cliffs. Plenty of beach bars with lovely views.
Beautiful breathe taken views we went on the Pedro so we could explore €10 for an hour , 2 restaurants very near I recommend Aquarius lovely food drinks, definitely worth visiting.

First impressions were not that well. The beach is big and sandy, which is nice, but the water is pretty shallow long way and full of sea grass and little stones. There are some pretty cool rocks on which you can climb, sit and enjoy the waves. Could be interesting if you like diving, but it's really not my type. When it comes to the Canal D'Amour it's a different story. Great for jumping into the water and the view is amazing. There is a solid rock you can climb on. It's nice for couples and those who travel alone or with friends, but not very good for little children because of the height.

Went for a day trip to Sidari from nearby Roda, after reading reviews we opted to take the green bus from Roda town which cost €7.60 and took about 30mins!! The town has many restaurants, clubs and souvenir shops. The canal d’amour is beautiful if your a swimmer and our kids loved the opportunity to cliff jump.theres a remote large rock out about 50m which is ideal to swim to and jump off and a large rock just a bit further that’s just out the water so you can swim out and sit on it and enjoy the view. When we arrived here there’s plenty of sun beds to use but there owned by hotels who charge €5 per person but you can use all there facilities which is pretty good. Overall it’s a lovely place to visit and a worthy day out! Or place to holiday. Bad points were the bus didn’t return with enough seats then the next one 10 mins after also had the same problem and the one 11/2 hrs later also didn’t arrive! So taxi it was HaHa joke that is as it also took 45mins to get one after numerous phone calls!! So if going to Sidari for a day be warned!!

Traveling alone so visited this place after a few locals said it's a beautiful place, they were right. It's relaxing to go to even when it's busy it's not a loud or congested busy it's just people enjoying themselves and the view.
This is Really Postcard picturesque !!! We Swam in the Sea & it was Great Wish i was There Right Now !! If you Go to Sidari, You Must Go to this Little Gem of a Beach, Wow !!
Pictures make it look better than it really is. The sea is not Turquoise blue as they suggest. Still a nice beach though with small inlets and ledges the less adventurous of us to jump from
We arrived after most people had left for the day.. absolutely gorgeous! Parking is tricky, but free if you use the tavernas. Best to swim round and from the Albania side back in!

Lovely views and great water but I would suggest getting there early as it does get very busy.  If you have kids I would suggest you also get there early as there is not much beach here and I am sure you would not want them sunbathing on the cliff side
Small beach reached by walking over a bridge over stagnant stinking water full of rubbish. Could barely see the beach or rocks as it was so packed with sun beds and umbrellas. Wouldn’t visit again.
Fabulous place, stunning scenery! Well worth taking a boat trip as seeing it from the coast is amazing!
Lovely view, nice cove to go snorkelling from. Can get very busy during the day as a major sightseeing spot for tourist.

We have walked into canal d'amour twice so far and it is beautiful. A short walk from our hotel in sidari. The restaurants are great. If you buy a drink or food you from them, you can use your sunbeds and pools free. It is beautiful and a great place to go and chill.
Didnt really swim here as quite crowded. Fab photos taken. Easy to get to and from, bar nearby to get a few moments out of the sun.
Lovely place to visit and the kids enjoyed climbing all over the rocks and taking lots of selfies with all the different rock behind them! Defiantly worth a visit.
Fabulous beaches for swimming cliff jumping. Great restaurants to eat at with sun loungers for the daytime free of charge if you purchase a drink Lovely sunsets in the evening

This is a must visit place when you are staying in Sidari, Corfu. If you go there in the evening at around 8pm you can watch the amazing sunset. During the day, there are a few different coves with beaches with crystal clear water, rock faces to each side and you can swim out easily out of the coves and round into caves. All the beaches have sun beds, umbrellas, but not sure as to the set up for all the beaches. Some may charge & some may let you use them for free, as long as you buy drinks etc.

I think the hype works against this place and it may be that its better form a boat but its a bit of a dissappointing walk in, the canal feeding it is dirty and smells of toilet and there was a lot of litter in the water. The sea part looks nice and its nice at night when its lit up but a bit overrated i thinkthis looks very average.
Kids loved jumping off the rocks into the water. The climb back up is a bit tricky though! A rope ladder would be a great addition. Views lovely and plenty of restaurants and sun beds close by.

column3: An overrated piece of tourist garbage
column4: We have visisted the Canal D’Amour promised a beautiful quiet place with clear water and an astonishing view . Instead What we got was an overrated small cliff (one of the smallest ones at that. If you want to see a beautiful beach with cliffs visit the Long Beach) near giant hotels. The view was... average. The cliff was small and honestly nothing special compared to places like the previously mentioned Long Beach. Not only that, but the water was mostly dirty. Perhaps the place is apears pretty if you go there by boat, but if you did not- you cannot even swim there! Overall I would not recommend visiting Canal D’Amour as it is an overrated and unpleasant place
Lovely clean place, there is a lot of bars restaurants and cafes around. Nice place to take photos and chill out.
A nice place where you may spend about 30 minutes.You will see the amazing shapes the see crafted from the cliffs.
Excellent and clean place to visit plenty of bars and beaches and free sun beds Great in the day and at night

Checked out location a few times wanting to take advantage of jumping into the sea. On a couple of occasions the exit point looked a bit dicey with people being washed off steps leading from the sea. So decision made check out swimming back round to Sidari beach which was pretty straightforward. So now to the jump son went straight for it I however had a long think about it before taking the plunge. Exit straightforward up steps cut into rocks the up onto top & yes jump again. Good fun. The coves are great. Locals say to be careful & check what’s beneath the water before jumping
Brilliant. Very beautiful im glad i went there! Fantastic views and food. It was on my list tp go amd see it.and i was mpre than happu to actually see it live! Please go and see it. Loved it

Went to Canal D'Amour with my family and what a place to see.. a certain must see! we spent the day in the restaurant/cafe that over looks the sea which if you stay there and purchase your drinks and food you can park and lay on thier loungers for free. They have thier own pool and very clean facilities. They have thier own private beech too! You can take a stroll across the edge of the island with plenty of spectacular views... and if your gutsy many were junping off the cliffs into the sea! Must see!!!

What an amazing place, it has everything to offer, great restaurants, bars and hotels for great food and drinks. The scenery is breathtaking and the sea is to die for. You can do many water sports and boat trips all priced very reasonably. Not to be missed.

The Corfu Island guides recommended this visit and after several trips to the beautiful Corfu beaches, city and cosy corners we were expecting something similar. However it looks as a bar with paella and plenty of beers. I didn't even was suggested to take a photo, more people than drops of sea water
Lots of beautiful restaurants and lovely views Ate here a few times Although shame about the smelly bridge But don't let that put you of
Awesome place . We stay like 10 hours there and the rock are beautifull. The resorts are super nice from what we saw there. And the canal have a nice view.
There are many lovely spots in there that deserve a memorable picture. Unfortunately not enough room for everyone as the beach is quite small.

Take a walk around the rocks from the main beach in Sidari, you will come to several small coves where you can sit on the beach or swim in the clear blue waters. The canal is particularly stunning, with caves to swim through and a stunning view.
Beautiful beaches recommended! A cliff that is relatively safe to jump from, that also has a rope from which you can get up again. Beach bars restaurants and shops all around for every taste.

The canal and coastline are very pretty, with a lovely cove. The canal is also lovely and a great place to swim and BASE jump into the water. The nearby town is a little like Blackpool - full of hotels, souvenir shops and restaurants. Great place to visit but not sure I would want to stay there for a holiday.
A beautiful stunning area of corfu.. The stunning views of the turquoise sea surrounding the cliffs is a must.

Interesting and unique rock formation but far too crowded in high season, waters in the area are quite murky as too is the shallow adjoining beach due to being overpopulated in the busy months, otherwise lovely place.

column3: Ruined by a massive hotel and ridiculous crowds
column4: The most striking view in Corfu that is talked up in all the day trips has been ruined with a massive hotel on top, covered in sun beds, rammed with pedaloes, and thronging with jeering crowds urging each other to jump off the rocks. Such a shame that it’s treated so poorly. They really spoiled this natural beauty spot.

Great views, there is a little cove were you can have a clay body mask for free, your skin will feel so good after washing it off. If you look at the rocks you will see a gray line, just wet with sea water and rub the gray strip,the clay will then be easy for you to rub all over your skin!!

column3: Nice beaches, great views, but too many people
column4: This is well known tourist attraction, so you have to go there early or off-season. These beautiful views are really magical and romantic. There are sandy beaches and nice sea. You can pay for sunbeds or you can stay on the rocks for free. It's up to you.

column3: Beautifull place but too full of tourists
column4: The canal is located in the middle of a very touristic village. In fact it is at the back yard of hotels. The canal is full of sun loungers and many tourists jumping to water etc. If you want to enjoy the beauty, come here early in the morning!
Certainly worth a short walk from the main strip to see this. Great views and some really nice beaches.
This is a beautiful place but good luck finding a sun bed ! The sun beds take up most of the space but fill up quickly, very picturesque setting though.

column3: Lovely if you pick your time!
column4: A great place to visit if you’re in the area. We stayed at Akron seascape that was on the doorstep so visited here a few times. If you visit earlier morning or late evening the scenery is lovely with great photo opportunities, however middays and early evening it gets you packed.
Stinks to high heaven, I'm no forensic expert but I trust my nose and know the stink of raw sewage when it hits me.

Canal was our last stop during trip along north-west coast. Whole area around Canal is private, I had impression, that we were walking through Hotel area to get there. Rocks and small bays looks very nice, whole place is surely scenic and worth at least short visit. You can jump into water or just swim surrounded by walls of Canal, which is interesting experience. Because of large number of people and noise, after short swimming and taking some photos, we went further.

Nice place to visit with nice beaches either side. If you are gutsy enough try jumping in to the channel, the hard part is climbing out. Suitable for all ages, couples, groups and families. The usual traditional Greek taverns, all of a good standard serving good food and very reasonably priced. Just returned after 1 week stay with friends, enjoyed evet minute.

column3: Tired ... come on Sidari clean it up !
column4: With so many tourists to the area you would think the local hotels and restaurants would want to look after this attraction.  No... filthy with overflowing litter bins, broken pathways and overgrown bushes.  Come on residents and business or Sidari sort it out !

Part of the Sidari resort of Corfu, the quieter end. Some lovely hotels right in the canal edge and a lot of basic rooms to rent. Although the area is beautiful looking out to sea, the main street is looking a little run down. There is a major problem with refuse on Corfu as the landfill is full and it can sit in the street for days and attracts vermin and cats. If you have always stayed in basic, value for money rooms, you will find a lot have not been updated in a while and some even not maintained. In general, I think unless a mass effort is made by owners to tidy up and maintain, people will choose other areas. It still is a friendly island with good tavernas to be found.
Stunning place, well worth a trip to even if you are not staying in Sidari. Try and visit at sunset - one of the most beautiful scenes I've ever seen!
Had a lovely walk round this place. Its absolutely amazing. Breath taking birws and is defo a must to come n see. Amazing amazing x
One of the most beautiful places on earth. If you go to Corfu, you have to swim in its canals. It is a must.
It was beautifull but full with drunk tourists. They literally can broke your time there. If u like to snorkeling don't go there. Never the less you should visit the beach.
A long time visitor here and what can you say..... lovely. Plenty of family Tavern's , Cafe's for light snacks /main meals. Lovely safe beaches with easy access...Great views..

As you walk onto the end part of the main sidari beach , towards the cliffs and the Canal , there is a bar with great sunbeds & pool just on the beach . The Taverna has shade under a wonderful tree and an excellent menu . Pay 10 Euro for a sunbed & brolly and they give you 10 Euro credit in the bar and restaurant .... Free sunbed . Use of their toilet and pool is also allowed . We used this for 3 days and enjoyed evry visit . Use this as your base to explore the Canal and the cliff walks or pedalos and boats .

column3: Lovely area shame about the litter.
column4: A really fantastic place to catch the sunset and take in the views, somewhat spoilt by lazy visitors not taking their rubbish away.
Not a single bad thing to put on the location, it is clean and stunning. We went in PEAK-week though and the place was VERY crowded.
Beautiful scenery & places to eat & drink, not far to get to from the main strip, well worth a visit.
The Canal D'amour is a must see! It's really beautiful with turquoise water for taking photos a have a drink near it.
We took a boat here from Arillas and saw this from the water perspective. It was fun to watch all the people jumping off the cliffs nearby.

This was a fun place to swim and hang out. They do charge for the sun beds but we opted not to pay and just put our stuff on the rocks and enjoyed the space anyway. We swam out through the canal. The waters were so beautifully green and blue swimming back and there’s a shelf inside where you can get out and walk around the cave or sit for a few minutes. Overall fun and great experience.
Stuning location. Full of natural beauty, very rustic and takes your breath away. Well worth a visit.
It was an interesting place to visit ,we spent there about an hour mainly for taking photos because we visited in the evening.Some people were still swimming.

column3: Over crowded and a lot of seaweed
column4: Not up to expectation the sea seemed very murky and the beach was overcrowded with sunbeds. The rubbish tips near by did not enhance my experience.
One of the best place in Corfu Island; if are some wind it is more spectacular; must be seen and walk around; real beach life and feeling

A lovely view and the sunset is ace - spend the day there, swim in the sea and swim through the Love Tunnel - Try the resturant at the very top of the path - Kahula it's brill with very good friendly staff - have a drink at the bar in the complex all staff are very friendly. A great day adventure.
Nature has made its job - you can admire beautiful view, but you will meet a lot of people there as well.

Stayed in Sidari so a nice stroll to this area. Lots of bars and restaurants too. Explored in the evening a few times, watching the sun go down. Nice place to wonder around. Lovely colours. Went in the day to swim through the canal and explore the cave. Great experience! A must thing to do if in the area.

column3: Half an hour of something different to see
column4: Well, it’s free and a bit different. Quite a windy and rough day when we were there but that made it more interesting. Not a destination in itself, but good when also visiting Longas Beach if you’ve got a car

Came here to see the views and the lovely bay. Was a very hot day and looked so tmpting to take the plunge and jump in however after seeing one girl do it and unable to get back out without the assistance of 3 folk I decided against it. Worth a visit to see the place however, as like the rest of Sidari, over commercialised. Had some drinks in the local bar and enjoyed the lovely surroundings. Been there, however having done it, in hindsight wouldnt have been too disappointed if we never had the time to go.
An area of breathtaking beauty, and was well worth the short walk from the beach. I was on my own, but felt like a romantic spot to visit
We stayed in the centre of Sidari so this was only a 15min walk away. It was so beautiful we came back multiple times over our week stay, it looks amazing at sunset!
what a beautiful part of Sidari the actual resort is like Blackpool but behind it all is this hidden gem stunning views beach side bars and restaurants to idle the sunny days away.
Arround the Canal d’Amour is an beautiful sea ...so clean ! Just have a look at my photos. I spent here amazing day.

If you want to experience something really beautiful and deep, wake up early and visit the canal before the sunrise and watch how the day wakes up. There are no people in the morning so the views plus water splashes and birds singing make it a surreal exprience.  At the same time i guess that in the afternoon it’s an absolutely different place with the crowds of tourists, high temperatures and the harsh light.
An amazing place to visit Clean and tidy Clear water and a great place to jump into the sea and swim Would return in a heartbeat

We visited Sidari, and on the whole, it was lovely to visit for the day - we could probably do two days at a push but as a Brit, I do my upmost to stay away from expats on holiday (sorry not sorry) it is a nice area, there’s a few hidden gems inside the town although there is a few Brit bars en route to the canal and on the main strip, which we avoided and preferred to go to a taverna or beach bar.  We did find a bar/pool bar located right next to the canal which featured a pool and shower, so if you went in the sea you could wash off the sand and dip in and treat yourself to a cocktail on a sun lounger while basking in the Greek sun.
lovely water but the bay is little so be there early if you want to find car park and space on the beach
The beach it s small and it has some sunbeds for 8euro/2. It s kinda crowded, it is worth visiting for a quick bath, but not spending a hole day here.

This was off the beaten track so to speak but it was a nice surprise to find. The views was brilliant. Not taking away from canal d’amour the only thing that annoyed me was the skips of over flowing rubbish in sidari itself and at the entrance to this beauty spot . It really has so much potential but this litter problem needs sorting.
Evening sunsets were fabulous. There are a number of bars to enjoy the sunset or just sit on thd rocks to enjoy the views which are beautiful.

Was hoping for a really special unique place that you could not find anywhere else . It’s ok but if I was not actually staying in Sidari I wouldn’t have bothered going . It’s not like the cliffs are particularly high or the sea is crystal clear or the near by beach is really beautiful. It’s just ok to take a look if your nearby .

Lovely coves and small beaches. Fantastic restaurants to enjoy a seafront view and drinks. You can walk along the pathway and climb onto the rocks. Sidari jetty run short boat trips around theCanal D'Amour for about 40 mins or so.
Just a perfect place beautiful setting beach not so good but views and clear blue water and so warm.

column3: A beautiful hidden cove. Fantastic sunset.
column4: The water is so clear and the sand so white it is just a beautiful place. We visited to watch the sun set and it was fantastic. There were loads of other people there all fixated on watching the sun go down and all the wonderful colours that lot the sky before slowly disappearing. The cove is enclosed by layers of cliffs and ledges and people can jump off the cliff ledges into the water and then swim back to the sand. There are small caves that you can swim under and the place is well worth a visit. We were lucky enough to be staying at the Akron Seascapes Resort situated on the cliff above the beach so felt spoilt by having this view all week. There are limited sunloungers on the beach so it's worth making an early start. Parking is just inside the hotel entrance and is at a premium so again an early start is advantageous.
Save your time and effort to go there 🙄 Was absolutely waste of time to drive to the north, very chaotic city and the canal was very crowded and had dirty water.
We drove over here around 8:30AM on a Sunday. This was the perfect time to see the beach and canal without a crowd. Breakfast was also delightful and inexpensive, less than €8 for a “Greek Breakfast”
Beautifull views on the cliff. Not far from main city street. I think the most beautifull place around Sidari

Well it’s definitely a must-see if you are on the island. It’s very picturesque and the legend around it is very sweet ❤️ I’d say it’s great for all types of travelers- couples, friends and familied with kids. The water is a bit cold though (or at lest it was when I was there)
Picturesque beach area adjacent to our hotel but just be careful with small children as it has some tricky walking areas.
Nice place watching people jumping off the rocks. Nice long walk from one end of beach to casa amour.
Very breath taking, lucky we stayed over looking it. Used the beach and on 2nd day found it far too noisy.
good unusual beach. great for swimming. nice for walking. some nice bars and places to eat. sidari is very nice.

Corfu canal d amore is intertwined with Sidari rocks so essentially the same place. My husband and I drove in from the city and surprised to see everything closed from restaurants and bars to hotels while we were there in November, clearly the off season. We knew it would be too cold to get in the water at this time of the year but would still recommend the visit as the views are beautiful and very private with no other tourist at this time of year. My only recommendation would be to pack a picnic lunch, otherwise you will be very hungry until you are back in the city.
Sidari is very beautiful place with many shops.Canal d’amour is the best place and most beautiful for the swimming.I adore this place and enjoy my swimming.
Lovely little beach at the back of our hotel “Akron seascape resort” can go walking over the rocks, cliff and there’s access down to the beach and sea. Can swim up to the little cave too

It’s pretty busy, but well worth the visit, as the place is beautiful and the views are stunning. There is a small beach which looked brilliant for families with young children, but it would get busy quickly, so I’d advise arriving early. We walked from sidari and there are plenty of cliff bars and places to eat with views from the cliffs

The apartments are perfectly adequate self catering apartments that are well serviced, clean and roomy. The complex though is in the perfect position, it is at the centre of everything. Classy old tavernas, 50 yards away, fantastic beach, 50 yards away, great pools, 50 yards away, shops, bank machine, bars..yes 50 yards away. If you wanted to go down the main street in Sidari thats about a 20 minute stroll, and that is perfect, because it means you can get peace and quiet here also. The staff cannot do enough for you, the pool bar/cafe perfectly adequate and reasonably priced...I could go on and on, I was here with my wife the first two weeks of June and I will definitely be returning again and again.
Had a meal in restaurant and see old friends ,we’ve not been in 10 years and they still remembered us all as we went as a group of 6 .It is still as beautiful as we remembered at canal da mour
A lovely location on a warm sunny day and easily accessible. Several tavernas at the location where you could enjoy a drink or meal and enjoy the view.
