Beautiful place to visit. The sunset is beautiful, amazing views, nice places to eat and have a drink.

Wonderful sandstone cove with small beach and refreshing deep water bathing. Gets fairly busy but plenty of parking nearby. I’d recommend taking the coastal footpath at the end of Sidari beach as this is much prettier than the direct walk along the road.
Visited last week whilst here in Sidari, didn’t think much of it at all. Beach had litter & rubbish floating at the shore edge, not very inspiring at all. I really don’t think it’s a pretty place!

Absolutely stunning and beautiful views. You can get down on to a small beach one side and swim under the cave that is called the tunnel of love. If your tall enough you can almost walk out to it. You can walk up the rocks and see some stunning views although it is quite dangerous and you need to be careful under foot. Not good if you don't have very good use of your legs. You can walk over the other side to a few nice restaurants but can still get access to them from the road side and see the stunning views. There are no barriers to stop you falling over the end of the cliffs just need your wits about you. Definitely worth a visit.
The canal d'amour is stunning if u get chance swim under the tunnel off love the sea is crystal clear
This was a beautiful destination for our honeymoon, the scenery was just outstanding. The perfect place for newlyweds and couples ❤

The name of the place is given from a small channel that binds the bathing bay with open sea. In the channel there are a ledge where you can sit and scribble your love notes on the wall. A bit overhyped all in all since the beach is small with little space for sunbathing
Hired a boat to come here by the sea. You can walk to it by land. Caves you can swim through. Cliffs you can jump off into the sea. Also big rocks further along you can dive sunbathe on.
Love a walk down to the canal. Stunning scenery,fabulous bars and restaurants. Always takes your breath away

As the title says its cool water is actually the perfect place to dive. Its far from the main town kerkyra , if you stay north is easy to visit. It was worth to see that place. Is better to park your car in Sidari 11 minutes away on foot rather than there because its difficult to find a place, go early in the morning if you want to park near the beach.

column3: Scenic Place with Interesting Rock Formations
column4: A very interesting and scenic place to visit for good photo opportunities due to the unusual rock formations. There's actually two Canal d'Amour's (the main one and a smaller one) which are right next to each other. If you are staying in or near Sidari, this is definitely worth a visit.

We were touring the Northern Tip of Corfu and were receommended to stop off here and find the location of the Canal D'amour. Glad we did. Tucked off the main road from Sidari is this little treasure. Sadly getting a bit too commercialised but well worth a stop

Its worth the short walkon the paved pathway from Sidari to Canal D'Amour beach. Great rocks carved by the sea. A bench in the shade with Jasmine and bourgainvilleas . There are 3 beaches with shallow water to paddle or swim. The restaurants provide sunbeds in the hope of your custom but there is plenty of sand for your towel. Or sandcastle.
Love this place, amazing scenery with lots of sea view restaurants around, the sea was clear with golden sand there are some walk way around the canal to get to cliffs and sea. Love this place

We went up to this place a few times whilst we were in Sidari and it has great views several bar/restaurants to keep you entertained each place we visited we found the staff,food,and drinks all top drawer with excellent service very attentive indeed. Please bare in mind if you have walking problems you my find some area's hard to reach but to be fair all try their very best to accommodate all comer's. It is a must see place if your in or around the resort of Sidari.
This beach is very beautiful with magnificent rock formations. The area is also a walkers paradise. It’s not suitable for people with physical impairment due to the steep access.
what ever you do don't leave Sidari without taking a walk up the side of the canal d,amour. beautiful scenery and clear blue seas.
We were lucky enough to stay overlooking the Canal D’Amour, it is a beautiful sight that is a must see if you are in the area. It does get quite busy at peak times. A good spot to watch the sunset.
Felt disappointed having walked from the opposite end of sidari. The beach at canal damour is barely accessible, no sunbeds, seaweed ridden beach, left disappointed

Really nice little beach. Spent an afternoon here in May with family. Water is shallow enough for kids to paddle in and for adults to walk quite far out too. Really picturesque and has a bar right next to it for refreshments and food which is reasonably priced too

column3: Beautiful Palace, but needs investment to protect it
column4: This is the second time we have visited the Palace, with a gap of around 11 years in between visits. While it is unquestionably beautiful it is now starting to show signs of neglect and the building needs some serious work to enable future visitors to continue to use it. On our last visit the statues were much cleaner but have been been left to the elements and are dirty and sad. The gardens are beautiful and the history is very interesting, this is enhanced by the audio guide which is available in several languages and will enhance your experience. Toilet facilities are very limited so expect a wait if it’s busy.  Entrance is reasonably priced and it makes a good stop off for an hour or two. Be aware that there is not a huge amount of parking available and that very large coaches use the roads so expect to have to give way or reverse.  Worth a visit if you are interested in history

The view,rocks and see in this point are wonderful. But the hotels,bars are to close to this treasute of natire and it spoils everything. Loud music,many drinking tourists, the full pools of the hotels surounding this place makes it the worst place in Corfu that we visited. The government shoudn't allow to bild hotels so near to this nature's pearl
Beautiful place, different than others and worth having coffee break at least. One of top 3 places in corfu for us.
We took a boat tour which was about 45 minutes and were happy about this decision as the views of the coast were really spectacular.

It's a lovely walk up and around the coastal path from Sidari to the Canal D'Amour - as for the Canal itself well... its nice and worth visiting but arguably a little overrated and not quite as good as the photos make it seem in my opinion.  Stil worth visiting, if ever so slightly underwhelming

Went to the Canal D'Amour, where there are three small bays that the sea comes into set against sandstone cliffs and relatively clear water. Very commercialised, and overdeveloped, felt more like a Benidorm feel to the whole place, heaving with burnt Brits mainly, either eating or sunbathing in and around the hotel pools and the myriad of cheap apartments overlooking the once beautiful secluded bays.We found the place quite 'pikey' and run down. However on a good note we did find a nice table overlooking one of the bays where the food was good (as is usual in Greece) and not too expensive. Local Tourist department need to get a grip here I feel as I can imagine it must have been beautiful once. i won't be returning personally not my cup of tea thanks.
Canal D’Amour is the best side of Sidari and a really friendly part of Corfu. It is well worth the drive to the north of the island. Sidari we will be back.
Second time here to Sidari. Every time we come here we visit Canal D’Amour. Breathtaking views and lovely place to walk around and spend the morning just watching the water hit to rocks.

column3: Dont go thinking that you are going to be amazed
column4: I don't know if it was due to the time of year (May) that we went. The beaches could be so much more inviting if they were cleaned up of rubbish and more importantly the seaweed covering a lot of the sand. For me Sidari just needs a general tidying up. We saw numerous bins overflowing with rubbish with loads on the floor. Even when the bins were emptied, the rubbish around it on the floor was just left. The water is clean and clear so if you like a dip in the sea its ok.
There are some pretty spots around Sidari, this being one of them however with bins overflowing, it ruins the area.
this is quite a nice alcove but the beach on it is tiny and the tide comes in quickly so watch out if your sun bathing and do'nt keep an eye on the sea, it may catch you by surprise.

Although a small beach the walk is very pleasant. Be aware that there are a few scary paths and bridges that have no handrails.  When we were there the beach empty as the weather was not to good however the sea was very clear and blue.

column3: Well worth a visit if you are staying locally in Sidari
column4: Wear suitable footwear as some of the climbs are slippy plus you’ll get to enjoy the views. There is a very nice restaurant with special views to sit and people watch and chill out, very nice and worth a quick visit.

column3: Just away from the noise of the Strip
column4: Far better to stay in the Canal D'Amour area unless you wish to party all night. Fabulous views of the cliffs coastline and sunset and plenty of good restaurants and bars without loud disco's although some venues to have entertainment on.

Head up to the NW coast to Sidari where you will find the Canal D'Amour Tunnel, about a 15-minute walk from town. You will have to go along some open resort properties and a few sketchy wood bridges to get there. Remarkable geographic feature that can be explored all the way up to some sheer cliffs on either side without any safety railings or warnings of sudden drops. The east side has the better views. The west side is a little hard to get to and the views are mostly blocked by vegetation. We spent about an hour there, if you include the 15 minute walk from town, where there is plenty of parking. We were practically the only ones there although I understand in the summer it is standing room only and a party atmosphere with all the pool bars surrounding it. Worth the trip if you happen to be in the area but would not make this a focus of your time on Corfu. Skip if pressed for time and definitely less attractive if rainy weather.
I absolutely love this place it is amazing there is such an a beautiful veiw from the top and the bays are fantastic to swim in . You have to see it.
A loverly spot to visit. Found in the north of Corfu Island at Siddari. It is a really good spot to get stunning pictures.  I highly recommend a visit.

column3: Worth a visit for a photo
column4: A pretty spot for a short photo stop. It was quite hard to find the right access road as some entry points were via hotel property. One of the main bars with the same name does not give you a view of the actual tourist spot instead its just a small beach. We walked and eventually found it.

column3: Nice but not the best place in the island.
column4: Nice place for taking a few picture or eat dinner in nice scenery...but if you do not like crowded and typical touristic places with hotels and apartaments around, you should not spend there more than few hours. However, worth to be seen because of the pics.

column3: Stunning views! And lots of lizards!
column4: The walk to canal d'amour (via the beach) from sidari is great!  Plenty of smaller canals to explore and we saw lots of wildlife including a few lizards! It's a fairly easy walk just the ground can sometimes be a little uneven.  Well worth the visit we went back for a second day of exploring this area as it was so beautiful!!

This is amazing following a trail of rock and greenery up and up with some of the most beautiful scenery. A photographer's dream. Lots of tavernas on the way to stop and have a drink and something to eat . If going to sidari it is a must see place you won't be disappointed

We went for a all and found this place. It was marvellous, a path leading up and up over a massive rock formation which goes up and across with some of the most beautiful views possible several tavernas on the way to stop and stare. This is a must see place in sidari. Wonderful

column3: It’s lovely, can be busy, uneven paths
column4: Parking is tricky, nice views and took the obligatory photos.  If you are unsteady on your feet then take care, especially at the top which has a shear drop with no warning or fence etc.  Just wasn’t for me, perhaps it had been oversold on how beautiful it was and my expectations were too high.

column3: Cliff diving for the brave of heart
column4: Watch brave young men jump and dive off unusual rock formations. Easy to jump off the rocks & not so easy to get back out.
Stunning views amazing walks wataching people jump from the cliffs absolutely amazing place would definitely recommend a visit

column3: Pretty but it's pretty all round the island, not just here
column4: It's not necessary to come here to see this - it is pretty, but the whole island is lovely. Beautiful even if the weather isn't great, fairly peaceful but touristy and plenty to eat and drink 10 mins walk away, some restaurants even have seats on the beach, very close to canal d'amour.
Been there last spring the view is spectacular i don't know about the beach a lot of places to eat or have a drink or coffee

Maybe the best place on the island. With the long tiny sand beach full of tavernas with musics and every kind of different foods, salads greeks or any other. There is a plenty of apartments and if you like it you can stay fore some days.!!!
Nice place.great views.good beach bar and wicked seating made from pallets and hanging chairs.good service
Beautiful place worth a walk along the beach stopping for a cold drink and something to eat there is plenty of places to sun bath and to climb if you in to that on holiday
We visited sidari for the day its a long drive but its full of scenery ...it was a beautiful day so we visited beach its sandy and very beautiful place.

Visited Canal D'Amour last August with my 2 sons and my ex husband on a day out while on holiday in Corfu. I swam the length of the canal backwards and forwards - it was like being in a mineral spa! The water was so clear, deep green, and the darkest night blue. I closed my eyes and wished, 'let me find my new true love' as I swam. Well, two months later I met my present partner in my local post office and we are very happy. So, you never know what could happen if you swim in this canal. It is a stunning place to visit. If you are brave enough, jump off the cliff not the water below. If not, just let yourself down into the water using the rope attached to a rock. Well worth the effort.

column3: B E A U T I F U L
column4: Lovely place to visit when in Corfu! It is located on the north side of the island! The rocky formations make the perfect scenery to dive in the blue waters, enjoy the natural beauty and the breathtaking view!

We felt privileged to have come to canal d’amour in winter as we were the only visitors and had the beautiful views to ourselves. We drove in a rented car from the hotel as the city bus wasn’t operating this day. Unfortunately the restaurant was closed and the car park semi abandoned but otherwise the area was very relaxing and worth the trip.

column3: realy lovely natural diving area very fun for youngsters ;;;;
column4: it was a really diffrent experience to swim in such a beach front , amazing high spots for diving made my kids bring out the dare in them :;;unforgetable //

column3: Be careful when climbing and taking selfies
column4: A major attraction not only for Corfu but also for Greece, this place is equally interesting to visit on foot and to watch from a boat. Be careful when climbing it and taking selfies, there have been many accidents with tourists falling into the sea from a height throughout the years.

The Canal D,About is on the edge of Ducati a place where you can just relax and unwind,plenty of walks,lovely beaches and some wonderful and inexpensive Taverns, l would say it's more for the middle aged and older generation. However if you want the disco bars and live music a 5minute walk will take you into the heart of Sidari, something for all.
Staying in Sidari it is an easy walk. Good to see. Many diving and jumping from this area. Plenty of places en route to eat or have a drink.

First time in Sidari and we loved it, can't wait to return next year. We explored the Canal D'Amour area a few times and went over to the cliff area and beach, however at the time of us being there it appeared there was a strike taking place with the refuse collection. This made the area very unpleasant to walk through. We ate at a lovely British pub, food was great. Definitely recommend
This view is incredible it alone is well worth your stay here. We got this view from the hotel bar and enjoyed in morning and night while eating our meals
Worth visiting and has stunning views and lovely places surrounding to eat and drink. We hired a pedalo which was for an hour. Definitely worth doing as great fun.
beautiful well worth the visit beautiful hidden coves with sunspots crystal waters for snorkling and lovely hill top resturants and tavernas

Honestly the most beautiful views of the sea and rocks. Me and my best friend heard many legends of this place, apparently if you meet somebody there, they'll be your one true love. The canal is supposed to be the "canal of love". It was definitely worth the visit. A lovely walk in the sun and some of the best restaurants, they really don't play when it comes to the food!
This is a little cove with a cave/tunnel. Legend say's if you swim it's length you will meet your one true love. It's hard to get near with all the youngsters jumping from the rocks.
Defo worth a visit, the views are phenomenal and worth the walk. Beach bar does amazing Baileys Frapes.

Nice restaurants, good views, swimming ,Sunbathing,Walking a nice place to have a coffee and cake or just swimming through the hole in the rocks made by thousands of years of the sea wearing the rock away.
Our second visit to Sidari and we love to go to Canal D'Amour, a beautiful place with stunning views. We went end of September so was quite busy.
Fantastic views, lots of little coves to explore and spend your days. Great swimming areas, activities and bars to keep you busy for days on end.
This is a great spot to see , we spent a couple of hrs just taking it all in .it was very busy. But we went back later in the day there are sun beds to hire but expensive so don’t bother.
It is amazing what a nature can create! Beautiful azure water, amazing shapes of sandstone. The beach is not particulary big, but worthy visiting.
Amazing place for photos swimming diving . The best area for view and swimming . I recommend that place to everyone
This is probably the only part of Corfu I actually enjoyed! Canal D’amour is beautiful! It’s a shame about Sidari!
We was in sidaria for two weeks ,only had a walk here in the day ,was a nice day to stroll and have a look around ,nice little beach and coves ,quite afew bars and shops ,
Beautiful scenic area with restaurants looking over the beach and a lovely place to take walks or swim in the canal d'amour

This was an amazing find, we has the sun blazing and it just light up the rocks making them look beautiful with the blue sea. We decided to climb some of the rocks and get to different heights and over look the beach and can see the country Albania from here as well. We will return before the end of her holiday with better footwear so we can explore more of the rocks , there is a rope which goes into the water which I'm guessing is for people who like to cliff jump into the sea but I'm not sure if it's safe to do so or not. Either way it's a beautiful spot.
Was lovely walking to this area, some lovely photos taken very picturesque went twice as took daughter and boyfriend when they joined us on holiday

Visually everything it says in the brochure, however in October we had strong winds making the sea a bit uninviting, had to be there early to get a place on the beach. Ample bars restruants around to have a rest, coffee or a beer.

Truly breathtaking. You will definitely need your camera for this piece of paradise. Fabulous beaches and amazing view. It's worth heading down in the evening too see the most amazing sunset and catch the warm sea breeze. My partner and I will definitely be returning next Sep.
We came here when the sea was rough and when it was calm, great place to be both times! Would recommend the shirt walk from sidari to see it!

Totally and utterly heaving. No room anywhere, on any of its beaches  Water looked particularly murky. Definitely not for us, perhaps because coming from the Gower, we have some of the world's best beaches on our doorstep. Therefore I wouldn't necessarily put anyone off from visiting  If like us you don't like it, then you can use the large swimming pool of the Zafiris hotel, provided you're buying drinks, as we did
The Canal D'Amour is at the end of Sidari, a busy, lively resort. A surprise for such a resort. A must for people visiting Corfu.

column3: Great place for jumping into th esea or for those not so brave, watching others jump in the sea
column4: Great place to swim, jump in sea or for the not so brave...people watching. Particularly beautiful for watching the sun set
Lovely views lovely little cove could get busy at peak seasons,very close to sidari walking distance.

Was a little disappointed on visiting this location advised by many guides, the weather wasnt great for our visit so perhaps this was the cause. All around the location is built up including the area very close to it which detracts from the beauty and means parking and access is not easy to navigate. This would not be on my list of places which you must see on Corfu.

A beautiful area of Sidari walking through the rock formations and following the tiny paths on the edge of cliffs it works so you have to pass through cafes and restaurants on the way with then stunning views out to see. ! I know they have political problems with refuge collection at this time but please don't let the area become shabby with small amounts of rubbish on view. (I picked some of it up as passing) Also the path through getting a little tricky in places ? apart from that a lovely place and worth a visit.
we walked up to have a look at canal D,Amour and its breath taking would recommend the hour long boat trip as this shows the other side and for ten euros not to be missed
Everyone that visits sidari should have a walk and visit this beautiful place. We were lucky our hotel was actually on this beauty spot so we got to see it everday

column3: Beautiful spot - must see in Corfu Island
column4: If going by bus you need to catch a green bus from the station in Corfu Town – follow the signs to it. The beach and rock scenery are amazing. You can use a sunbed so long as you buy something to eat / drink and at the time we went (mid Sept) it was not too busy. Not sure if there is enough happening in the area to warrant staying there as a base and it was a bit too ‘touristy’ but it was definitely worth a visit.

We visited here whilst in Corfu and the views are beautiful, The water near the beach was abit murky because the bottom and side of the rocks are clay, once you swim out abit the water is very blue and clear, we swam through the cave and jumped off the rocks, we also rented a paddle board which was a really nice experience, if you’re in the area I would recommend you visit here.

What a magical place! Mother nature at her finest. It's very easy to find. We took the bus from Acharavi. It's a 5 minute walk from where the bus stops. There's a path that you can walk round the cliffs are the views are spectacular. Not particularly suitable if you are unsteady on your feet. Well worth a visit.
Amazing place! I was surprised how beautiful view I saw. Nice and warm water, jumping into water from cliff. Love it!

A must to go and see and swim in the channel of love. It is beautiful with some wonderful scenery. Theres plenty to do here in Sidari with lots of bars and restaurants and shopping. We stayed in Kanoni but hired a car to see this place and we are so glad we did. Cedar is definitely the place to be

Got here early one day i.e. 9 AM and it was already getting busy. Swam here with my daughter and the water was very murky and rough. I have done it, ticked off the list and personally wouldn't bother.
Lovely views! Area is somewhat crowded with beach bars but this is a must see spot. Wear walking shoes as quite sandy and hilly to navigate.

Visited Sidari in September 2018 and stayed in Canal D^Amour area. It is a spectacular area, unique rock formations, sheltered coves, crystal clear water, very shallow in parts. Lots of sunbathing space on the rocks. Great for diving. There are plenty of restaurants and bars in the area to relax and enjoy the wonderful views. Aquarius restaurant has lots of seating where you can have a drink or snack by day and candlelight meal at night and enjoy the fantastic sunrises and sunsets. Canal D^Amour is a very special place.
Went for a walk by the Canal D'Amour and was not impressed. Had to cross a foul smelling canal to get there. Nothing really there. A few shops and restaurants but nothing worth going there for.
What a great place to relax and chill out, it can get quite busy and has some quite steep pathways to get to the sandstone rocks.
Absolutely loved this place, so beautiful, came to see the sunset . Such a gorgeous place. About 1/2 hour walk from Sidari.

column3: iWas there, nice cliffs, nice area
column4: close to the main beach, you could reach it by walking it is not nice to pass through the sewage area, but it worth to do it you could dive from the small cliffs, you could climb the sticky rocks using a rope or passing through a small narrow tunnel then, you could feel love, i don't know :)
Enjoyed a visit there. Nice place to walk around and take beautiful pictures of the surroundings 😁😁😁😁😁
Had a meal at the top of the hill that belongs to the zafaris resort. What a great place to see the sunset with wonderful views of the canal d’amour.
Beautiful area with little coves and bays with amazing views. Some nice little restaurants to enjoy lunch or a cocktail or two. Lovely part of Corfu.

The place is a jewell of the nature, but ...absolutelly full with tourist, shouting microphons telling you about offers and dances. If you look for grat land scapes, you can go to many others in the island no so spoiled. If you look for lots of british tourist and cheap food...this is your place

column3: The place stinks and is full of wasps
column4: Don’t know what all the fuss is about with this place.  Yes there is a nice view from here but that is it.  There is a horrible stench coming from loads of dead fish under the bridge.  If you sit for a drink you’ll be sharing it With countless wasps  Worth a look but that’s it. On the plus side there are some nice restaurants nearby offering quality food at reasonable prices
Ive been there with my boyfriend it is such a romantic place that every one have to visit .i suggest it..
Glad we saw this as spent a few hours watching the younger ones jump off the cliffs into the water, not for me but great to watch
Beach is very narrow and the people are on the beac crowded together like sardines far too busy some bars close by but parking a nightmare I would not recommend a visit

You will see some nice views from this place. Unfortunately the place became a too big of a tourist attraction, which causes it loosing its charm. Nevertheless if you are in the North of corfu, you should visit it.
Loads of areas to swim with lovely views plenty of sea activity’s and plenty of bars and shops close by
It was ok nice to look at but I was expecting a canal to swim along. Beware of people on boats and canoes!

This is a truly natural beauty spot. Just a 15 min walk from Sidari this is definitely a must see. Great place to eat and drink and swim. Photographers dream. Well worth a look, you will not be disappointed.
Lovely little beach. Perfect for the kids. Lovely bar and restaurant next to it. Definitely recommended

A great place to visit and even better to stay, so many great restaurants and views. One of the prettiest and most accessible places on the island. Within 15 minutes walking at least 100 bars and tavernas, beautiful beaches, clear waters. Everything from full English breakfasts for €3 euros to fine dining.
Love this beach so beautiful the rock formations are stunning definitely worth a visit. The big canal damour beach sign is a nice touch to the scene
Beautiful place to visit, we loved it, sandstone rocks with a beautiful sunset. Good clean beaches, plenty of sun beds too

Went here for lunch on 2 separate occasions, both times very good, had longer wait second time and was given free soft drinks. Can use sunbeds and beach free of charge. Really lovely. Its round the back of other part of Canel D'Amour, have lovely garden,s to lay on beds, pool area.

Had a walk up here with my wife plus my brother in law & my sister in law, when you walk up to the top through the bushes the views are amazing you can see all the resort, we spent about an hour here & we all enjoyed it, if you have the chance to go I would recommend.

Compared with so many other lovely inlets and bays this is done to death and overrun with package holiday tourists on a deal. You won't find many Greek people here despite the fact that the sea is lovely but there are strong currents so it isn't suitable to all. Don't plan on having a nice lunch here as the restaurants are pretty poor.

This is a short piece of sandy beach with about 20 sun beds (lady turns up very quickly for €10). It would probably be nice if it wasn’t so little and thus so overcrowded. You can swim and certainly see the Albanian mountains which are pretty but overall I think the place doesn’t do justice to its name. You won’t miss anything if you don’t visit this place.
Lovely place, worth the visit, Sidari is full of nice places but very quiet. Great for couples. Glad we decided to visit.
would recommend you takeing dive of the rock. blue sea amazing followed by a icecream in many cafes close by.
Jumping from the cliff tops to the clear blue waters kept us entertained and was really genuine fun.
Worth a visit but only if your nearby, beautiful clear water, popular for swimming and jumping off the cliff.
Probably over commercialised a little. Would have been better if not over-run by sunbeds. There was literally no beach left uncovered. Still worth a visit.

If you desire to see some rocks in a special shape as s carstic phenomenon then you have to visit Canal d'Amour. You have a complete view over the whole bay. The beach is small so you might go a few meters to the left until Sidari beach.
Amazing views, you can see Albania as well! The cliffs are wonderful, but it can get quite windy and dusty. It's worth a visit however!

column3: Nice stopover dtring North Corfu visit
column4: Beautiful bay, worth to visit and swimm in the sea. Friendly small bars, hotel around, Nice view around tha area

Canal D’Amour We were staying at Roda and called at Sidari for the day and thought we had better check out the Canal D’Amour. Access by car is easy enough with plenty of parking near the top of the cliffs, which is free. Access to the cliffs and then into the sea is more difficult for those less than fully able bodied. It’s quite a beautiful spot and the geology and caves are interesting. The sea is funnelled into the bays that are created and is akin to a giant wave pool. Not much of a beach area, especially with the tide in. Didn’t use what sun loungers were there (pay). If you are near Sidari it’s a must see even if you don’t stay there for too long.
Do you like crystal clear water, clean beaches, and tranquillity? Then better not go to Canal D'Amour. We actually started laughing when we arrived - it was utterly grotesque.

Beautiful spot to visit,if you decide to jump in the water,be ready for cold water. But the beach near Canal is not great,dark sand mucky water and to many tourist.No beautiful views around the Channel.

A beautiful view, especially at sunset. So many people walking around during August and some of the pathways around the area were falling into the sea. I found it incredibly sad that there was so much litter in the area. I don't understand how humans can spoil such an amazing place :(
To stay on the beach was too crowded and to have a beach lounger, it was 10 Euro each. Ridiculous because who does that money go to? Who OWNS that beach?
Canal D'Amour cove is absolutely wonderful. We visited while on holiday, There is plenty of bars and restaurants, Some with sea views

column3: Best mud mask I’ve ever had
column4: Sidari beach is awful but canal d amour I liked, yes it too could do with a bit of a clean up as there are bits of junk on the beaches broken loungers and brollies etc but the water is amazing and the natural mud on the rocks makes for thee best ever body and face mud mask you’ll ever try, sit and let it bake on in the sun then jump in the water to remove WOW our skin was awesome. Some bars there too serving cocktails etc, as a bit of a hippie I loved it and so did my wife and 12 year old daughter.

We stayed at Canal Damour for our 2 week holiday with two children 11:13. It was prefect for us , beautiful beautiful views on the morning of awakening.  Watching the brave people cliff diving all around was spectacular.  It was a 5 minute walk to a bigger beach , where all the water sport amenities were available .  Perfect location - fantastic tavernas and little souvenir shops . Not tacky and a supermarket at the end of our road .  For us a family of four , our first ever visit , we LOVED it and were glad we chose the quieter area of Canal D’amour .  Beautiful place
The view is beautiful but is ok just to cross by. It is not enough space for relax just for take a bath and move on.
Nice little place to visit esp if tide is coming in and the surge of water is quite a sight. Nice hour or two to pass the early evening

column3: What is all the fuss about?
column4: As attractions go this has to be one of the worst I have ever been to. A scruffy piece of beach surrounded by tavernas. Allow 5 minutes for your visit including travel.
Visited canal damour in August for a week....it’s ok but not much to write home about , it’s very scenic and it’s nice to jump off the rocks but it’s a small beach and gets packed quickly

column3: this place is lovely, with fantastic views
column4: think this may well be one of the more expensive places to stay but if you have the money to do it. why not.
My hubby and I spent a good few hours here, swimming in the warm sea, covering ourselves with the clay mask! The swim through the cave was amazing and well worth the effort!
Nice location to visit in Sidari. In Sidari otherwise there is not much to see. Easy to park nearby. And plenty of restaurants to have a drink or something to eat.
This place looks better on the pics. There were waste in bushes, beach was a bit dirty and the water was cloudy. Not wanted to go to swim.

Great panoramic views amazing beach. Best beach bar in the area is the Mojito where you get great service from Dimitris and another young girl, which I am sorry I forgot her name. Dimitris makes you feel so welcome that you want to keep going back every day!
Great walk along the beach to Canal D'Amour. Beautiful location and views. Definitely worth a visit if you are in Corfu

With my wife we spent a day in Sidari and enjoyed the place. The water is warm and clean and you can climb onto those cliffs and jump from there. The beach is small therefore I would suggest to take long chairs near a pool. The only condition is to drink something as the chairs are free. We took one drink and enjoy the place for the whole day

The rock formations are fascinating and the swim through the tunnel was a great experience. However water v murky due to clay material. Beach is tiny and as ever charged for loungers. Have seen it, enjoyed it but wouldn't rush back again as other beaches on island nicer to spend day. The main town is one of those British friendly strips eg bars with sky, fried breakfast, Guinness on tap and endless souvenir shops- horrible not what I come on holiday for but suits many compatriots

Stayed here in early August and had a great time some lovely beaches to visit and some good night life too only a 5 minute walk into so dark where there are plenty of bars and restaurants will go here again
if u go sidari u hav too go here it is breath taking watching the waves crash though the gauge, u can watch people jump and dive in they have some balls

It was way too much people, probably better in June or September. Felt like having an uncomfortable, lukewarm bath with 500 people . Water was unclear, mostly to do with natural clay that people kept smearing their bodies with. Cool small cave you can swim through.
This place, like Sidari, is overrun with tourists (mostly families with kids), crowded to the point of bumping into people and really quite ugly. Dirty, pedestrian and boring, don't bother.
Brilliant experience, rubbing rock all over body like mud bath, water shallow n as warm as a bath, u can walk out rather far out in sea , fabulous time
This little cove is great, you can swim out to the end of the cove and climb out on tho the rocks and sunbathe

column3: Not missing much - better from boat
column4: Its very crowded - some nice bays, but mainly all hotels and bars. You wouldn't be missing much if you went. Get a better view from a boat as you can see all the cliff formation etc
It's gorgeous and lovely to walk around, it gets busy very early so if you want photos with less random people in go early!  Really lovely geological structures.

column3: Well worth seeing from both land and sea.
column4: You dont really get the full apreciation of this feature without seeing it from the sea. It is within easy reach of the Pedalo, Kayak and obviously then the power boats you can hire. Its a beautiful rugged landscape and worth the effort to reach it by sea too. Access by land will also give you stunning views of the bay and be sure to go to all penisula tips.

A must when staying at the canal d amour area. I swam through the cave it was a little choppy at the other end but glad I had a go. The water is shallow at first no good for children that can’t swim. The clay from the walls is a must. We did this twice and enjoyed it. Didn’t try the beach but beautiful views as our hotel was right behind this place. Great sunset from here too.
Probably high season it's the reason. So you get the idea... My girls like better the almiros beach.
We've been here many times and it's perfect. Beaches are nice and the sea is shallow for quite a distance. There are two rocks to swim to and the water is clear. It's a must to visit in Sidari!

Nice clean beach, very kids friendly as the water is shallow. We really liked it, did not have the feeling that is overcrowded or too loud. Yes there are many families as everywhere else. Quite mainstream but still good.
We visited this outstanding area and we were completely blown away with the beauty of it. All I can say is it is well worth the walk there and there is several photo opportunities on route.
We went here 18months ago in May and it rained nearly all of the week we were there. And enjoyed the canal so much we wanted to see it in the sunshine and it was amazing didn't let us down

If your in Sidari then you have to swim through the Canal d'amour don't you. Access to the beach isn't really suitable for anyone with any sort of limited walking ability as steep steps are part of the route down. The water is relatively shallow (I could stand up and I'm 5'9") right up to the entrance and 3/4 of the way through the tunnel. Once through you are in to the clear deeper waters of the med. Like I've said your in Sidari, you have to do it, it's traditional.
One of the nicest places at northern Corfu ! It definitely deserves a visit. There are lovely beach bars and restaurants all over and you it is also easily reachable by car.

there is a coastal type path that runs along most of the coast that covers this area well, the area is good for wheelchair users but there is also a few hard to reach more better for able bodied. there is many areas to jump into the sea below and there is two cafes/pubs beer at 2 euro a pint , ideal for the sunset which is very good to watch. the ground does have a paved path for the not so abled but limited areas this runs to. there is no charge to the cliff

column3: Good beach, views and sea swims
column4: This area has little rocky outcrops and small beaches. You can walk most of the clifftop, swim round, through a cave etc. Very popular with Greeks as well as tourists. Water is shallow so good for swimming a fair distance. Not good for snorkeling as there is no visibility near the beaches and very few fish.
This is a small cove where the water is mirky due to the clay in the area the sun beds are expensive at 4 Euros each and its not a full day excursion but its worth a visit
Interesting place for swimming through the caves and jumping from the cliffs if you are brave enough

column3: Canal D'amour at sunrise was amazing
column4: We stayed at the Canal D'amour for 2 weeks and the sunrise was amazing. It has stunning views and is by far the better place to stay in Sidari

Decided on a quick stop at this spot to see what all the fuss was about. It was easy to find and easy access. The area was heaving with plenty of rude Europeans. Stayed for about an hour and half whilst the boys jumped off the 20ft rocks. The rocks are covered in clay and it was fun to cover ourselves , let dry and wash off for a smooth exfoliation. It’s worth a quick visit just for the experience but beware it’s super busy. There are no showers to wash as well

Looks great on pictures, but is extremely small, very difficult to walk in the water as the bottom is clay like substance. Beach is tiny and very overcrowded, do not pay extortionate day trip prices from other resorts to go here, as it does not pose value for money. We went in our hire car and stayed just a couple of hours.
Amazing views well worth a visit, great picture opportunities, great atmosphere and lovely tavernas situated around the Canal D'Amour

Wow it's simply a beautiful amazing bar & restaurant. Stunning view's, and a drinks list to die for , catering for all ages and tastes.. It's just a dreamy place to chill out and be totally relaxed and entertained. And the added bonus if your a thrill seaker there is a cliff to jump off in to the crystal clear waters, no joke it brilliant and it right next to the Canal D'amour. Once you've been, I'm sure you will return. Enjoy.
This is a spot for people to dive off the cliffs and swim in the caves. The beaches are rubbish here and the sun beds have to be paid for.

Having visited the place with my family, I can say that it is an interesting experience, but not to be repeated. The place was overcrowded and the rental of sunbeds was overpriced. We stayed there for one hour or so, we have covered ourselves with clay, swam a little bit and left. Nothing great, but still a good experience to remember 👍
You can get a wonderful view of the canal from the mountain. I liked swimming in the canal but there were too many people for my liking. A bit too commercial, but definitely worth visiting

My wife and I are staying at Christos Apartments on the Canal D'amour and we love it. There's a great mix of things to do and places to go locally. The cliffs and scenery, the various beaches, the traditional Greek tavernas and restaurants as well as Sidari being a 10min walk away for pubs and clubs and great night life!

column3: A long drive for little reward
column4: Apart from some interesting cliffs, Canal D’Amour was disappointing. There were so many tourists and snack bars and so much musak that the natural beauty was somewhat swamped. If you want real beauty without all the tourist tat, head for Porto Timoni beach. It’s a bit of a trek, but well worth the effort.
Amazing views and great swimming and the most amazing sunset 🌅 an amazing restaurant to give you all the views a most visit in Corfu
Visited here last week with my family, absolutely beautiful area and great views , has a few sunbathing areas and restaurant/bars . Definitely worth a visit in staying in the area .

column3: Much better coves elsewhere on the island
column4: Only stayed for an hour despite only staying 10 minutes away.  Far to busy and water had lost it's lovely colouring- probably due to the mounds of people in the water.  Shame really.  Much nicer small beaches in Corfu.  Worth a short visit perhaps if you're in the area
3 rd time back to Sidari, 2nd to Canal D’Amour and the Kanali apartments.. stunning weather and views x great hospitality x absolutely love the place x kids did too
Stunning views and a good place for cliff jumping and easy access to local restaurants and bars and other close by beaches.
During the summer season the tiny beach is full of people and the water loses its great turquoise colour. It looks much better in the pictures!!
Stunning beach area and lovely lively town. Lots of live entertainment bars and restaurants Free use of sunbeds in beach bars if you eat or drink in there
I walked here with my friend from Legends Apartments on a very sunny day and I could say it had a breath taking view

Nice place to spend a few hours. Natural rock formations. Wonderful views. Nice place to go for a swim.. cliff jumping in a couple of places if your brave enough. Plenty of food refreshments available nearby. A little busy and people should respect the area by taking their litter home.

As the title suggests Canal D'Amour is a game of two halves. The opening gambit is a thoughly embarrassing affair which shames me for being part of the human race. The litter and detritus from badly managed tourist influx and our own individual lack of responsibility to our planet is a total embarrasment... It really is shameful. So for this bit I give a zero rating and beseech all those that visit this area of natural beauty to take home their rubbish and also one or two bits of horrendous plastic waste that will be sprinkled about the place.  The second half is pure natural beauty which only intensifies the embarrassment of the first half performance.  Beautiful sandstone strata constantly eroded by the persistence of the ocean beautifully illustrates the consistent eloquent force of nature. Such a shame therefore that this is within the context of short sighted, selfish and crude irresponsibility for our natural environment and that of our children.
Sidari is very touristy but the Canal D'Amour is very beautiful and well worth a visit. You can also do some water sport activities while you are there from the main beach

Canal D’Amour is so perfect! It’s about a 15 minute walk from Sidari right up to the rock at the top of the Canal! The sights at the top are perfect - definitely take your camera!! The water is a beautiful aqua blue/green colour - try to avoid a windy day though, we ended up absolutely covered in sand because the wind was so strong.
Beautiful place although very busy at mid day im unsure about other times. Now a place close to my heart as my partner proposed to me on top of the cliff overlooking the beautiful scenery!
You cannot be in Corfu without visiting this beautiful place. if you are young and not afraid from heights it is possible to jump to the sea and it's not so scary.

On the outskirts of Sidari, the area is well worth visiting both by day and for the sunsets. It consists of a number of channels where the sea has cut through the sandstone, with a path which offers great views. There are a number of excellent restaurants nearby.
Nature at its most splendid! Walk along the cliff top paths to see the crevices & caves - also lots of opportunities for adrenaline junkies to leap into the sea below.
Nice swim and interesting attraction to do with kids. Good sea and it’s accessible from the land and water (by boat)
nice beach very close to Zafiris hotel. the views are breath taking and the weather is amazing. it was a small cove near our hotel but had a cave that you could swim through
Canal d'Amour is a natural channel that has been created by wave action. It lies within a headland that is equally impressive. Great geology, lovely views over Sidari and well worth a visit.

column3: Lovely location well worth a visit
column4: Gorgeous views at canal d amour and well worth a visit but naturally it is very popular so very busy. We paid for sunbeds and spent an afternoon enjoying the calm water, the tunnel and the cliff jumping. The pictures make it look secluded but it actually has restaurant's around it so not very peaceful.
